THE DIGITAL PERSONAL DATA PROTECTION ACT, 2023
(NO. 22 OF 2023)
[11th August, 2023.]
An Act to provide for the processing of digital personal data in a manner that
recognises both the right of individuals to protect their personal data and the
need to process such personal data for lawful purposes and for matters
connected therewith or incidental thereto.
BE it enacted by Parliament in the Seventy-fourth Year of the Republic of India as
follows:––
CHAPTER I
PRELIMINARY
1. (1) This Act may be called the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023.
(2)  It shall come into force on such date as the Central Government may, by notification
in the Official Gazette, appoint and different dates may be appointed for different provisions
of this Act and any reference in any such provision to the commencement of this Act shall
be construed as a reference to the coming into force of that provision.
Short title and
commencement.

requirement: This Act shall be called the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023.
requirement_description: The official title of the Act is the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023.

controls.control: Establish a comprehensive data protection policy that outlines the organization's commitment to protecting personal data, data collection and usage practices, and procedures for handling data breaches.

Classify personal data into different categories based on its sensitivity and risk level, and implement appropriate controls to protect each category, such as encryption, access controls, and data retention policies.

Implement a consent management system that allows individuals to provide informed consent for the collection, use, and disclosure of their personal data, and ensure that consent is obtained prior to collecting sensitive data.
Collect and process only the minimum amount of personal data necessary to achieve the specified purpose, and ensure that data is not collected or stored for longer than necessary.
Implement access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to personal data, and that access is granted based on the principle of least privilege.
Establish data retention and disposal policies that outline the procedures for storing, archiving, and disposing of personal data, and ensure that data is not retained for longer than necessary.

Establish a data breach notification procedure that requires notification to affected individuals and regulatory authorities in the event of a data breach, and ensure that notifications are made in a timely and transparent manner.
Establish procedures for handling data subject rights, such as the right to access, correct, and erase personal data, and ensure that these rights are exercised in a timely and transparent manner.

Provide regular data protection training to employees to ensure that they understand the organization's data protection policies and procedures, and are aware of their roles and responsibilities in protecting personal data.

Promote data protection awareness among employees, customers, and other stakeholders to ensure that they understand the importance of protecting personal data and the organization's commitment to data protection.

requirement: The Act shall come into force on a date appointed by the Central Government.
requirement_description: The Act will come into effect on a date specified by the Central Government, which may be different for different provisions.

controls.control: The Central Government shall define the effective date of the Act in a gazette notification, specifying the date on which the Act shall come into force. This date shall be communicated to all stakeholders, including government departments, regulatory bodies, and the public.

controls.control_title: Publish the Effective Date in Public Domain
controls.control: The Central Government shall publish the effective date of the Act on its official website, social media channels, and other public platforms to ensure widespread awareness and accessibility to the public.

controls.control_title: Maintain a Record of Effective Date
controls.control: The Central Government shall maintain a record of the effective date of the Act, including the gazette notification and any subsequent communications, for future reference and audit purposes.

All government departments, regulatory bodies, and stakeholders shall ensure that they are compliant with the effective date of the Act, and take necessary steps to implement the provisions of the Act from the specified date.

requirement: Personal data shall not be processed without consent...
requirement_description: Organizations must obtain consent before processing personal data.

controls.control: Obtain explicit consent from data subjects before processing their personal data. This can be done through a clear and concise statement that explains the purpose of data collection, storage, and processing.
Implement a consent management system that allows data subjects to easily provide, withdraw, or modify their consent. This system should be accessible and user-friendly.
Maintain a record of consent procedures, including the date, time, and method of consent collection. This documentation should be easily accessible and up-to-date.
Ensure that clear and concise information about data collection, storage, and processing is provided to data subjects. This information should be easily accessible and understandable.
Regularly review and update consent procedures to ensure they remain relevant and compliant with changing regulations. This includes reviewing consent forms, procedures, and documentation.

requirement_title: Establishment of Data Protection Board of India
requirement: The Central Government shall establish the Data Protection Board of India under section 18.
requirement_description: The Central Government is required to establish the Data Protection Board of India, which will be responsible for overseeing data protection in India.

controls.control_title: Establish Data Protection Board of India
controls.control: Establish the Data Protection Board of India under section 18 of the relevant legislation, with clear roles and responsibilities, and ensure it is adequately resourced to perform its functions.

Define the membership and composition of the Data Protection Board of India, including the number of members, their qualifications, and the selection process, to ensure diversity and expertise in data protection matters.

Ensure the Data Protection Board of India operates independently and autonomously, free from undue influence or interference from the Central Government or other stakeholders, to maintain its integrity and impartiality.

Develop a clear governance framework for the Data Protection Board of India, including policies, procedures, and guidelines, to ensure effective management and oversight of its functions and activities.

Provide regular training and capacity building programs for the members and staff of the Data Protection Board of India to ensure they have the necessary skills and knowledge to perform their functions effectively.

Establish clear reporting mechanisms for the Data Protection Board of India to report to the Central Government and other stakeholders on its activities, progress, and decisions, to ensure transparency and accountability.

requirement: Significant Data Fiduciaries shall appoint a Data Protection Officer under section 10.
requirement_description: Significant Data Fiduciaries are required to appoint a Data Protection Officer to oversee data protection within their organization.

controls.control: Significant Data Fiduciaries shall appoint a Data Protection Officer (DPO) as per section 10. The DPO shall be responsible for overseeing data protection practices, ensuring compliance with data protection regulations, and serving as a point of contact for data subjects and regulatory bodies.

The DPO's responsibilities shall be clearly defined and documented. This includes, but is not limited to, data protection impact assessments, data breach notifications, and ensuring data subject rights are respected.

The DPO shall be independent and impartial in their role. They shall not be influenced by business or commercial considerations, and their primary responsibility shall be to protect the rights of data subjects.

Significant Data Fiduciaries shall provide the DPO with necessary training, resources, and support to perform their duties effectively. This includes access to relevant data protection laws, regulations, and industry best practices.

The DPO's appointment shall be reviewed and updated as necessary. This includes ensuring the DPO's skills and knowledge remain relevant and up-to-date with changing data protection regulations and industry standards.

requirement: Consent Managers shall be registered with the Data Protection Board of India.
requirement_description: Consent Managers, who act as a single point of contact for Data Principals to manage their consent, must be registered with the Data Protection Board of India.

controls.control_title: Register Consent Manager with Data Protection Board of India
controls.control: The Consent Manager shall be registered with the Data Protection Board of India within 30 days of the effective date of the regulation. The registration process shall be completed by the designated Compliance Officer.

controls.control_title: Maintain Accurate and Up-to-Date Registration Information
controls.control: The Consent Manager shall ensure that all registration information is accurate, complete, and up-to-date. This includes contact details, business information, and any other required documentation.

controls.control_title: Provide Proof of Registration to Auditors
controls.control: The Consent Manager shall be able to provide proof of registration with the Data Protection Board of India to auditors and regulatory bodies upon request. This may include a copy of the registration certificate or a letter from the Data Protection Board of India confirming registration.

The Consent Manager shall designate a Compliance Officer who is responsible for ensuring compliance with the registration requirements. The Compliance Officer shall be knowledgeable about the registration process and shall be able to provide guidance and support to the Consent Manager.

The Consent Manager shall regularly monitor its registration status with the Data Protection Board of India and update its registration information as necessary. This includes notifying the Data Protection Board of India of any changes to the Consent Manager's business information or contact details.

requirement: Any person who determines the purpose and means of processing personal data shall be considered a Data Fiduciary.
requirement_description: Any person who determines the purpose and means of processing personal data is considered a Data Fiduciary and is subject to the provisions of this Act.

controls.control_title: Define Data Fiduciary Roles and Responsibilities
controls.control: Establish a clear definition of a Data Fiduciary within the organization, including the roles and responsibilities of individuals who determine the purpose and means of processing personal data. This should include documentation of their duties, accountabilities, and reporting lines.

Maintain a list of all individuals who are considered Data Fiduciaries within the organization, including their names, job titles, and contact information. This list should be regularly reviewed and updated to ensure accuracy and completeness.

controls.control_title: Provide Training on Data Fiduciary Responsibilities
controls.control: Develop and provide regular training programs for Data Fiduciaries on their roles and responsibilities, including the importance of protecting personal data and the consequences of non-compliance with data protection regulations.

controls.control_title: Review and Update Data Fiduciary Roles and Responsibilities
controls.control: Regularly review and update the definition of Data Fiduciary roles and responsibilities to ensure they remain relevant and effective in protecting personal data. This should be done at least annually, or whenever there are changes to the organization's data processing activities.

requirement: Any person who processes personal data on behalf of a Data Fiduciary shall be considered a Data Processor.
requirement_description: Any person who processes personal data on behalf of a Data Fiduciary is considered a Data Processor and is subject to the provisions of this Act.

controls.control_title: Define Data Processor Roles and Responsibilities
controls.control: Establish clear roles and responsibilities for Data Processors, including their obligations under the Data Fiduciary's data protection policies and procedures. This includes defining the scope of their work, the types of personal data they will process, and the measures they will take to protect that data.

controls.control_title: Conduct Background Checks on Data Processors
controls.control: Conduct thorough background checks on all Data Processors before allowing them to access personal data. This includes verifying their identity, checking for any past convictions or disciplinary actions, and assessing their reputation and trustworthiness.

Implement access controls to ensure that only authorized Data Processors can access personal data. This includes using secure authentication and authorization mechanisms, such as passwords, biometric authentication, or smart cards, and limiting access to the minimum necessary for each Data Processor to perform their tasks.

Regularly monitor Data Processor activities to ensure they are complying with the Data Fiduciary's data protection policies and procedures. This includes reviewing logs, conducting audits, and performing regular checks on Data Processor systems and processes.

Provide regular training to Data Processors on the Data Fiduciary's data protection policies and procedures, as well as any relevant laws and regulations. This includes training on data protection best practices, data breach response procedures, and the importance of maintaining confidentiality and security.

Maintain up-to-date contracts with Data Processors that clearly outline their obligations and responsibilities under the Data Fiduciary's data protection policies and procedures. This includes specifying the scope of their work, the types of personal data they will process, and the measures they will take to protect that data.

requirement: The individual to whom personal data relates shall be considered the Data Principal.
requirement_description: The individual to whom personal data relates is considered the Data Principal and has rights under this Act.

controls.control: Implement a process to verify the identity of the individual to whom personal data relates, such as through a government-issued ID or a secure authentication method, to ensure that only authorized individuals can access and manage their personal data.
Obtain explicit consent from the Data Principal before collecting, processing, or sharing their personal data, and maintain a record of such consent for auditing and compliance purposes.

controls.control_title: Provide Data Principal Access and Control
controls.control: Implement a system that allows the Data Principal to access, update, and delete their personal data, as well as control who can access and share their data, such as through a secure online portal or a data subject access request process.

controls.control_title: Train Staff on Data Principal Rights
controls.control: Provide regular training to staff on the rights and responsibilities of the Data Principal, including how to verify identity, obtain consent, and provide access and control to personal data.

controls.control_title: Monitor and Audit Data Principal Interactions
controls.control: Implement a system to monitor and audit interactions with the Data Principal, including access requests, data updates, and deletions, to ensure compliance with data protection regulations and policies.

requirement: Digital processes capable of operating automatically in response to instructions shall be considered automated.
requirement_description: Digital processes that can operate automatically in response to instructions are considered automated and are subject to the provisions of this Act.

controls.control: All digital processes capable of operating automatically in response to instructions must be clearly identified and documented. This includes processes that use APIs, scripts, or other forms of automation.
Detailed documentation of automated processes must be maintained, including the purpose, inputs, outputs, and any dependencies. This documentation must be easily accessible to all stakeholders.
Automated processes must be thoroughly tested to ensure they operate as expected and do not introduce any security risks. Testing must be performed before and after any changes to the process.
Automated processes must be monitored to detect any issues or errors. This includes logging and alerting mechanisms to notify stakeholders of any problems.
Any changes to automated processes must be carefully managed and approved. This includes documenting the change, testing the updated process, and notifying all stakeholders.
Automated processes must be designed and implemented with security in mind. This includes using secure protocols, encrypting sensitive data, and authenticating users.

requirement: An office shall adopt an online mechanism for conducting proceedings.
requirement_description: An office must use an online mechanism to conduct proceedings, from receipt to disposal.

controls.control: Select and implement a reliable online proceedings platform that supports video conferencing, screen sharing, and document sharing. Ensure the platform is accessible on various devices and browsers.
Regularly conduct security audits on the online proceedings platform to identify vulnerabilities and ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of proceedings data.
Develop a user guide and provide training to office staff on the use of the online proceedings platform, including features, functionality, and best practices for conducting online proceedings.
Develop and establish a policy for conducting online proceedings, including guidelines for participation, etiquette, and technical requirements.
Conduct regular user feedback and evaluation to identify areas for improvement and ensure the online proceedings platform meets the needs of office staff and participants.

requirement: Personal data shall be in digital form.
requirement_description: Personal data must be in a digital format.

controls.control: Establish a clear policy that requires all personal data to be stored in digital form. This policy should be communicated to all employees and stakeholders involved in data handling.

Ensure that the organization's digital data storage infrastructure is designed and implemented to securely store and manage personal data in digital form. This includes the use of secure servers, data centers, and cloud storage solutions.

Develop and implement a process for converting paper-based personal data into digital form. This process should ensure that all data is accurately and securely converted, and that any paper-based data is disposed of in accordance with data protection regulations.

Provide regular training to employees on the importance of storing personal data in digital form and the procedures for doing so. This training should cover best practices for digital data storage, including data encryption, access controls, and backup procedures.

Implement a regular backup and recovery process for digital personal data to ensure that data is not lost in the event of a system failure or other disaster. This process should include both on-site and off-site backups, as well as a disaster recovery plan.

requirement: Gain is defined as a gain in property or supply of services, or an opportunity to earn remuneration.
requirement_description: Gain is defined as a gain in property or supply of services, or an opportunity to earn remuneration.

controls.control: Establish a clear policy that defines gain, including property or supply of services, and opportunities to earn remuneration. The policy should be communicated to all employees and relevant stakeholders.
Provide regular training to employees on the defined gain policy, including scenarios where gain may be involved. This training should be mandatory and documented.

Regularly monitor employee activities, including financial transactions, to identify potential gain-related activities. This monitoring should be done in accordance with the defined policy and procedures.
Establish a reporting mechanism for employees to report any gain-related activities or suspicions. This mechanism should be confidential and anonymous.

Conduct a regular risk assessment to identify potential gain-related risks and develop strategies to mitigate them. This assessment should be done in accordance with the defined policy and procedures.

Establish clear consequences for employees who fail to comply with the gain policy, including disciplinary actions and potential termination. These consequences should be communicated to all employees and relevant stakeholders.

requirement: Loss is defined as a loss in property or interruption in supply of services, or a loss of opportunity to earn remuneration.
requirement_description: Loss is defined as a loss in property or interruption in supply of services, or a loss of opportunity to earn remuneration.

controls.control: Regularly conduct risk assessments to identify potential sources of loss, including property damage, supply chain disruptions, and loss of business opportunities. This will help to prioritize mitigation efforts and ensure that the organization is adequately prepared to respond to potential losses.

Develop and implement a business continuity plan that outlines procedures for responding to and recovering from losses, including property damage, supply chain disruptions, and loss of business opportunities. This plan should be regularly reviewed and updated to ensure that it remains effective.

controls.control_title: Maintain Accurate Records of Assets and Liabilities
controls.control: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of assets and liabilities, including property, equipment, and supplies. This will help to ensure that the organization has a clear understanding of its financial position and can quickly respond to losses or disruptions.

Implement measures to improve supply chain resilience, including diversifying suppliers, implementing just-in-time inventory management, and establishing relationships with backup suppliers. This will help to minimize the impact of supply chain disruptions and losses.

controls.control_title: Provide Training on Loss Prevention and Response
controls.control: Provide regular training to employees on loss prevention and response, including procedures for reporting losses, responding to emergencies, and recovering from disruptions. This will help to ensure that employees are aware of their roles and responsibilities in preventing and responding to losses.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Loss Reviews and Analysis
controls.control: Conduct regular reviews and analysis of losses to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement. This will help to inform mitigation efforts and ensure that the organization is taking a proactive approach to preventing and responding to losses.

requirement: Personal data shall be defined as any data about an individual who is identifiable by or in relation to such data.
requirement_description: This requirement defines what constitutes personal data, which is essential for compliance with the Act.

controls.control: Establish a data classification policy that clearly defines what constitutes personal data and ensures that all employees understand the importance of handling personal data securely.
Implement measures to ensure that personal data is collected and stored in a secure manner, including encryption, access controls, and secure storage facilities.
Implement role-based access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to personal data, and that access is granted on a need-to-know basis.
Implement data minimization practices to ensure that only the minimum amount of personal data necessary for the intended purpose is collected and stored.
Establish a data retention and disposal policy that outlines the procedures for retaining and disposing of personal data, including secure deletion and destruction methods.
Provide data subjects with clear information about how their personal data will be used, stored, and protected, including the right to access and correct their data.
Establish a data breach notification policy that outlines the procedures for notifying data subjects in the event of a data breach, including the timing and content of notifications.

requirement: A personal data breach shall be defined as any unauthorized processing of personal data or accidental disclosure, acquisition, sharing, use, alteration, destruction, or loss of access to personal data.
requirement_description: This requirement defines what constitutes a personal data breach, which is essential for compliance with the Act.

controls.control_title: Implement Personal Data Breach Incident Response Plan
controls.control: Establish a comprehensive incident response plan that outlines procedures for detecting, containing, and responding to personal data breaches. The plan should include roles and responsibilities, communication protocols, and procedures for notifying affected individuals and regulatory authorities.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Risk Assessments and Vulnerability Scans
controls.control: Regularly conduct risk assessments and vulnerability scans to identify potential security weaknesses and vulnerabilities that could lead to unauthorized processing of personal data. This includes assessing the security of third-party vendors and suppliers.

Implement access controls and authentication mechanisms to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to personal data. This includes implementing role-based access controls, multi-factor authentication, and secure password management practices.

controls.control_title: Monitor and Log Personal Data Access and Processing
controls.control: Implement logging and monitoring mechanisms to track access and processing of personal data. This includes logging user activity, data access, and data modifications to detect potential security incidents.

controls.control_title: Provide Data Protection Training to Employees
controls.control: Provide regular data protection training to employees to educate them on the importance of protecting personal data and the procedures for handling personal data breaches. This includes training on data handling, data storage, and data disposal practices.

controls.control_title: Develop Data Protection Policies and Procedures
controls.control: Develop and maintain data protection policies and procedures that outline the organization's approach to protecting personal data. This includes policies on data collection, data storage, data sharing, and data disposal.

requirement: Personal data shall be processed in a manner that includes collection, recording, organization, structuring, storage, adaptation, retrieval, use, alignment, or combination, indexing, sharing, disclosure, restriction, erasure, or destruction.
requirement_description: This requirement outlines the various operations that constitute processing of personal data, which is essential for compliance with the Act.

controls.control: Implement a secure data collection process that includes obtaining explicit consent from data subjects, ensuring data minimization, and storing data in a secure and encrypted manner. This includes using secure protocols for data transmission and storing data in a centralized repository with access controls.

Implement role-based access control and authorization mechanisms to ensure that only authorized personnel can access and process personal data. This includes implementing least privilege access, regular reviews of access rights, and revoking access when personnel leave the organization.

Establish a data retention policy that outlines the duration for which personal data will be stored and the procedures for disposing of data when it is no longer needed. This includes implementing secure deletion procedures and ensuring that data is disposed of in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.

Implement procedures for sharing and disclosing personal data with third parties, including obtaining explicit consent from data subjects, ensuring that third parties have adequate security measures in place, and monitoring data sharing activities.

Establish procedures for responding to data subject requests, including requests for access, correction, erasure, and restriction of processing. This includes implementing a process for handling complaints and ensuring that data subjects are aware of their rights.
Implement robust data security measures, including encryption, firewalls, and intrusion detection systems, to protect personal data from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, or destruction.

Implement a data backup and recovery process to ensure that personal data is not lost in the event of a disaster or system failure. This includes regularly backing up data and testing backup procedures.

Establish procedures for educating data subjects about their rights and the organization's data protection policies, including providing clear and concise information about data collection, use, and sharing practices.

requirement: The Central Government shall notify Data Fiduciaries or classes of Data Fiduciaries as Significant Data Fiduciaries under section 10.
requirement_description: This requirement outlines the procedure for notifying Significant Data Fiduciaries, which is a procedural requirement for compliance with the Act.

controls.control: Develop and implement a process to notify Data Fiduciaries or classes of Data Fiduciaries about their designation as Significant Data Fiduciaries under section 10. This process should include clear guidelines, timelines, and communication channels for notifications.

controls.control_title: Maintain a Register of Significant Data Fiduciaries
controls.control: Create and maintain a register of Data Fiduciaries or classes of Data Fiduciaries designated as Significant Data Fiduciaries. The register should include details such as the name of the Data Fiduciary, their class, and the date of designation.

Regularly conduct audits and reviews to ensure that Data Fiduciaries or classes of Data Fiduciaries designated as Significant Data Fiduciaries are complying with the requirements and obligations under section 10. This should include monitoring their data processing activities, security measures, and compliance with data protection regulations.

Provide training and awareness programs for Data Fiduciaries or classes of Data Fiduciaries designated as Significant Data Fiduciaries on their obligations and responsibilities under section 10. This should include information on data protection regulations, security best practices, and compliance requirements.

Develop and implement a compliance framework that outlines the procedures and guidelines for Data Fiduciaries or classes of Data Fiduciaries to follow in order to comply with the requirements and obligations under section 10. This should include policies, procedures, and standards for data protection, security, and compliance.

requirement: Data Fiduciaries shall provide notice to Data Principals of the specified purpose in accordance with the Act and its rules.
requirement_description: This requirement outlines the procedure for providing notice of specified purpose to Data Principals, which is a procedural requirement for compliance with the Act.

controls.control: Provide a clear and conspicuous notice to Data Principals at or before the point of data collection, stating the specified purpose for which the data will be used. The notice should be easily accessible and understandable by the Data Principals.

Ensure that the notice to Data Principals includes the following information: (1) the purpose for which the data will be used, (2) the categories of third parties to whom the data may be disclosed, and (3) the rights of Data Principals to access, correct, and delete their data. The notice should be in plain language and free of technical jargon.

Provide notice to Data Principals at or before the point of data collection, and update the notice as necessary to reflect changes in the purpose or categories of third parties to whom the data may be disclosed. The notice should be provided in a timely manner, ideally within a reasonable timeframe (e.g., 30 days) after the data is collected.

Maintain records of the notices provided to Data Principals, including the date and time of notice, the purpose and categories of third parties disclosed, and any updates to the notice. The records should be kept for a reasonable period (e.g., 2 years) and made available upon request by regulatory authorities or Data Principals.

Ensure that the notice to Data Principals is accessible to all Data Principals, including those with disabilities. This can be achieved by providing the notice in multiple formats (e.g., text, audio, braille) and making it available through multiple channels (e.g., website, mobile app, email).

controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall provide clear and conspicuous notice to the Data Principal at the time of data collection, including the purpose for which the data is being collected, the types of data being collected, and the potential recipients of the data.

controls.control_title: Notice to Data Principal upon Data Sharing
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall provide notice to the Data Principal prior to sharing their personal data with third parties, including the identity of the third parties and the purpose for which the data is being shared.

controls.control_title: Notice to Data Principal upon Changes to Data Use
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall provide notice to the Data Principal in the event of any changes to the purpose for which their personal data is being used, including the reason for the change and the updated purpose.
The Data Fiduciary shall maintain records of all notices provided to Data Principals, including the date and time of notice, the method of notice, and the content of the notice.

controls.control_title: Notice to Data Principal in the Event of a Data Breach
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall provide notice to the Data Principal in the event of a data breach, including the nature of the breach, the types of data affected, and the steps being taken to mitigate the breach.

controls.control: Establish a data localization policy that ensures all digital personal data collected within the territory of India is stored within the country. This policy should be clearly communicated to all stakeholders, including employees, customers, and third-party vendors.

controls.control_title: Digitalisation of Personal Data: Data Minimisation
controls.control: Ensure that only the minimum amount of personal data necessary for the intended purpose is digitised. This includes avoiding the digitisation of sensitive personal data unless absolutely necessary.

controls.control_title: Digitalisation of Personal Data: Data Quality
controls.control: Verify the accuracy and completeness of personal data before digitising it. This includes checking for any errors or inconsistencies in the data.

controls.control_title: Digitalisation of Personal Data: Data Protection by Design
controls.control: Implement data protection by design principles when digitising personal data. This includes considering data minimisation, data protection, and data security from the outset of the digitisation process.

controls.control_title: Digitalisation of Personal Data: Data Subject Consent
controls.control: Obtain explicit consent from data subjects before digitising their personal data. This includes providing clear information about the purpose and scope of the digitisation process.

controls.control_title: Digitalisation of Personal Data: Data Retention
controls.control: Establish clear data retention policies for digitised personal data. This includes specifying the duration for which the data will be retained and the procedures for deleting or anonymising the data when it is no longer needed.

controls.control_title: Digitalisation of Personal Data: Data Security
controls.control: Implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure the security of digitised personal data. This includes protecting against unauthorised access, use, disclosure, alteration, or destruction of the data.

controls.control_title: Data Processing Agreement with Third-Party Vendors

controls.control_title: Risk Assessment for Cross-Border Data Transfers

controls.control_title: Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA) for Cross-Border Data Transfers

controls.control_title: Data Subject Rights and Grievance Redressal Mechanism

controls.control: Classify personal data as sensitive and ensure that it is only processed by individuals for personal or domestic purposes. This includes implementing a data classification policy and providing training to employees on the proper handling of sensitive data.

controls.control_title: Implement Access Controls for Publicly Available Data

controls.control_title: Monitor Public Availability of Personal Data
controls.control: Regularly monitor publicly available sources for personal data that may be subject to this Act. This can be done through the use of automated tools or manual checks.

requirement_title: Data Fiduciary Shall Process Personal Data for Lawful Purpose
article_text:
CHAPTER II
OBLIGATIONS OF DATA FIDUCIARY
4. (1) A person may process the personal data of a Data Principal only in accordance
with the provisions of this Act and for a lawful purpose,—
(a) for which the Data Principal has given her consent; or
(b) for certain legitimate uses.
(2) For the purposes of this section, the expression “lawful purpose” means any
purpose which is not expressly forbidden by law.
5. (1) Every request made to a Data Principal under section 6 for consent shall be
accompanied or preceded by a notice given by the Data Fiduciary to the Data Principal,
informing her,—
  (i) the personal data and the purpose for which the same is proposed to be
processed;
  (ii) the manner in which she may exercise her rights under sub-section (4) of
section 6 and section 13; and
 (iii) the manner in which the Data Principal may make a complaint to the Board,
in such manner and as may be prescribed.
Illustration.
X, an individual, opens a bank account using the mobile app or website of Y , a bank.
To complete the Know-Your-Customer requirements under law for opening of bank account,
X opts for processing of her personal data by Y in a live, video-based customer identification
process. Y shall accompany or precede the request for the personal data with notice to X,
describing the personal data and the purpose of its processing.
(2) Where a Data Principal has given her consent for the processing of her personal
data before the date of commencement of this Act,—
(a) the Data Fiduciary shall, as soon as it is reasonably practicable, give to the
Data Principal a notice informing her,––
(i) the personal data and the purpose for which the same has been
processed;
  (ii) the manner in which she may exercise her rights under sub-section (4)
of section 6 and section 13; and
 (iii) the manner in which the Data Principal may make a complaint to the
Board,
in such manner and as may be prescribed.

requirement: A person shall process personal data only for a lawful purpose.
requirement_description: Data Fiduciaries must only process personal data for purposes that are allowed by law.

controls.control_title: Define Lawful Purpose Before Data Collection
controls.control: Before collecting any personal data, the organization must define the lawful purpose for processing that data. This purpose should be documented and communicated to all relevant stakeholders.

When processing personal data for a purpose that requires explicit consent, the organization must obtain clear and unambiguous consent from the data subject before processing their data. This consent should be documented and stored securely.

controls.control_title: Review and Update Lawful Purpose Regularly
controls.control: The organization must regularly review and update the lawful purpose for processing personal data to ensure it remains valid and compliant with relevant laws and regulations. This review should be documented and communicated to relevant stakeholders.

controls.control_title: Train Staff on Lawful Purpose and Data Protection
controls.control: The organization must provide regular training to staff on the importance of processing personal data for a lawful purpose and the procedures for ensuring compliance. This training should be documented and evaluated to ensure its effectiveness.

controls.control_title: Document Lawful Purpose and Data Processing Activities
controls.control: The organization must maintain accurate and up-to-date records of the lawful purpose for processing personal data and all data processing activities. These records should be securely stored and made available for inspection by relevant authorities.

controls.control: The organization shall obtain explicit consent from the Data Principal before processing their personal data. This consent must be clear, specific, and freely given.
The organization shall maintain a record of all consents obtained from Data Principals, including the date, time, and method of consent. This record shall be easily accessible and up-to-date.

The organization shall provide clear and concise options for Data Principals to give or withdraw their consent. This includes providing information on what data will be processed and how it will be used.

The organization shall regularly review and update the consent obtained from Data Principals to ensure it remains valid and accurate. This includes checking for any changes to the data being processed or the purposes of processing.

The organization shall ensure that consent is given voluntarily and without coercion or undue influence. This includes avoiding any actions that could be perceived as pressuring or manipulating Data Principals into giving consent.

controls.control_title: Notice to Data Principal Before Data Processing
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall provide a clear and concise notice to the Data Principal before processing their personal data. The notice shall include information on the purpose of data processing, the types of data to be processed, and the duration for which the data will be retained.

controls.control_title: Data Principal Consent for Data Processing
controls.control: The Data Principal shall provide explicit consent for the Data Fiduciary to process their personal data. The consent shall be obtained through a clear and transparent process, and the Data Principal shall have the right to withdraw their consent at any time.

The Data Fiduciary shall maintain a record of all notices provided to Data Principals, including the date and time of notice, the purpose of data processing, and the types of data to be processed. The record shall be retained for a minimum of 5 years.

The Data Principal shall have the right to opt-out of data processing at any time. The Data Fiduciary shall provide a clear and easy-to-use process for Data Principals to exercise their right to opt-out, and shall ensure that their personal data is deleted or anonymized within a reasonable timeframe.

requirement_description: Data Fiduciaries must inform the Data Principal about their rights and the process for making complaints to the Board.

controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall clearly and prominently display a notice on their website and any other relevant platforms, stating the Data Principal's rights and how to exercise them. This notice shall be easily accessible and understandable by the Data Principal.

The Data Fiduciary shall establish a complaint mechanism that allows the Data Principal to submit complaints regarding their rights. This mechanism shall be easily accessible, transparent, and free of charge. The Data Fiduciary shall respond to complaints within a reasonable timeframe and provide a resolution or explanation.

controls.control_title: Train Staff on Data Principal Rights

The Data Fiduciary shall maintain a record of all complaints received and responses provided. This record shall be kept for a reasonable period and shall be used to track trends and improve the complaint mechanism.

controls.control: Develop and implement an automated data inventory system to track and identify existing personal data. This system should be able to identify data subjects, data categories, and data locations to facilitate the provision of notices to Data Principals.

Establish a process to identify Data Principals and their associated personal data. This may involve using data matching techniques, data profiling, or other methods to accurately identify Data Principals and their data.

Develop a standardized notice template that includes the required information, such as the categories of personal data processed, the purposes of processing, and the rights of Data Principals. The template should be reviewed and updated regularly to ensure compliance with changing regulations.

Establish a process for distributing notices to Data Principals, including the methods of communication (e.g., email, postal mail, online portal) and the frequency of notifications. The process should ensure that notices are delivered in a timely and secure manner.

Implement a mechanism to track and record acknowledgement of notices received by Data Principals. This may involve using a digital signature or a simple acknowledgement checkbox to confirm receipt of the notice.

Provide regular training to Data Fiduciaries on the requirements for providing notices to Data Principals, including the content, timing, and distribution of notices. This training should also cover the importance of data protection and the consequences of non-compliance.

requirement: Consent must be free, specific, informed, unconditional, and unambiguous.
requirement_description: The consent obtained from the data principal must meet these criteria to be considered valid.

controls.control: Obtain explicit consent from individuals before collecting, processing, or sharing their personal data. This can be done through a clear and concise statement that explains the purpose of data collection, the types of data being collected, and how it will be used.

Provide clear and concise information to individuals about the purpose, scope, and consequences of data collection, processing, and sharing. This information should be presented in a way that is easy to understand and accessible to all individuals.

Ensure that consent is unambiguous and cannot be misconstrued. This can be done by using clear and specific language, avoiding ambiguous or vague statements, and providing individuals with a clear understanding of what they are consenting to.
Make consent unconditional, meaning that individuals should not be required to provide consent in order to access a service or benefit. Consent should be voluntary and not coerced in any way.

Document consent in a way that is easily accessible and verifiable. This can be done through electronic or paper-based records, and should include the date and time of consent, the individual's name and contact information, and a clear statement of what they are consenting to.

Regularly review and update consent to ensure that it remains valid and relevant. This can be done through periodic reviews of consent records, and should include updates to consent statements and documentation as necessary.

requirement: Consent must be limited to the minimum necessary data for the specified purpose.
requirement_description: The consent obtained must only cover the data necessary for the intended purpose, and not more.

controls.control: Establish a data minimization policy that outlines the minimum necessary data required for each specified purpose. This policy should be reviewed and updated regularly to ensure it remains effective.
Review and update data collection forms to ensure they only request the minimum necessary data required for the specified purpose. This includes removing any unnecessary fields or questions.

Implement data access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to the minimum necessary data required for their role. This includes implementing role-based access controls and regular access reviews.

Provide regular training to personnel on the importance of data minimization and the procedures for collecting only the minimum necessary data required for the specified purpose.
Document the data collection process to ensure that it is transparent and easily understood by all personnel. This includes documenting the minimum necessary data required for each specified purpose.

Regularly conduct audits to ensure that valid consent is obtained and used for processing personal data. This includes reviewing consent records, checking for expired or invalid consents, and verifying that consents are up-to-date.

controls.control: Ensure that clear and transparent information is provided to individuals about how their personal data will be used, stored, and shared. This includes providing easy-to-understand language and avoiding complex legal jargon.

controls.control: Regularly review and update consent templates to ensure they do not include waiver of rights. This includes reviewing all templates, forms, and documents used for obtaining consent from individuals.

controls.control_title: Train Staff on Consent Best Practices
controls.control: Provide regular training to staff on the importance of not including waiver of rights in consent. This includes educating staff on the potential risks and consequences of including waiver of rights in consent.
Conduct regular compliance audits to ensure that consent templates and forms do not include waiver of rights. This includes reviewing all consent-related documents and forms used by the organization.

(5) The consequences of the withdrawal referred to in sub-section (4) shall be borne

Illustration.
X, an individual, is the user of an online shopping app or website operated by Y , an
e-commerce service provider. X consents to the processing of her personal data by Y for the
purpose of fulfilling her supply order and places an order for supply of a good while making
payment for the same. If X withdraws her consent, Y may stop enabling X to use the app or
website for placing orders, but may not stop the processing for supply of the goods already
ordered and paid for by X.
(6) If a Data Principal withdraws her consent to the processing of personal data under
sub-section (5), the Data Fiduciary shall, within a reasonable time, cease and cause its Data
Processors to cease processing the personal data of such Data Principal unless such
processing without her consent is required or authorised under the provisions of this Act
or the rules made thereunder or any other law for the time being in force in India.

requirement: Every Consent Manager shall be registered with the Board.
requirement_description: Consent Managers must be registered with the Board.

controls.control: Develop and implement a clear registration process for Consent Managers, including submission of required documentation and approval by the Board. This process should be well-documented and easily accessible to all stakeholders.

Establish clear criteria for registering Consent Managers, including requirements for experience, qualifications, and any necessary certifications. These criteria should be regularly reviewed and updated as necessary.

controls.control_title: Maintain a Register of Consent Managers
controls.control: Create and maintain a centralized register of all registered Consent Managers, including their contact information, qualifications, and any relevant certifications. This register should be easily accessible to all stakeholders and regularly updated.

Conduct regular audits to ensure that all registered Consent Managers are meeting the established criteria and adhering to the registration process. These audits should be documented and any issues or concerns addressed promptly.

Assign accountability for the registration process and maintenance of the register to a specific individual or team, ensuring that there is clear ownership and responsibility for ensuring compliance with this requirement.

controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall maintain a record of all notices sent to Data Principals, including the date, time, and content of the notice. This record shall be stored securely and be available for audit purposes.

The Data Fiduciary shall maintain a record of all consents obtained from Data Principals, including the date, time, and content of the consent. This record shall be stored securely and be available for audit purposes.
The Data Fiduciary shall implement a process to verify that notices are delivered to the intended Data Principals, such as email or postal delivery tracking.
The Data Fiduciary shall implement a process to validate that consents are genuine and not obtained through coercion or deception.

The Data Fiduciary shall provide regular training and awareness programs for employees on the notice and consent process, including the importance of obtaining genuine consents and maintaining accurate records.

requirement_title: Data Fiduciary Shall Process Personal Data for Specified Purpose
article_text:
7. A Data Fiduciary may process personal data of a Data Principal for any of following
uses, namely:—
(a) for the specified purpose for which the Data Principal has voluntarily
provided her personal data to the Data Fiduciary, and in respect of which she has not
indicated to the Data Fiduciary that she does not consent to the use of her personal
data.
Illustrations.
(I) X, an individual, makes a purchase at Y, a pharmacy. She voluntarily provides Y her
personal data and requests Y to acknowledge receipt of the payment made for the purchase
by sending a message to her mobile phone. Y may process the personal data of X for the
purpose of sending the receipt.
(II) X, an individual, electronically messages Y , a real estate broker, requesting Y to
help identify a suitable rented accommodation for her and shares her personal data for this
purpose. Y may process her personal data to identify and intimate to  her the details of
accommodation available on rent. Subsequently, X informs Y that X no longer needs help
from Y . Y shall cease to process the personal data of X;
  (b) for the State and any of its instrumentalities to provide or issue to the Data
Principal such subsidy, benefit, service, certificate, licence or permit as may be
prescribed, where––
(i) she has previously consented to the processing of her personal data
by the State or any of its instrumentalities for any subsidy, benefit, service,
certificate, licence or permit; or
(ii) such personal data is available in digital form in, or in non-digital form
and digitised subsequently from, any database, register, book or other document
which is maintained by the State or any of its instrumentalities and is notified
by the Central Government,
subject to standards followed for processing being in accordance with the policy
issued by the Central Government or any law for the time being in force for governance
of personal data.

requirement: A Data Fiduciary shall process personal data for the specified purpose for which the Data Principal has voluntarily provided her personal data.
requirement_description: The Data Fiduciary must process personal data only for the purpose it was originally collected, unless the Data Principal has explicitly withdrawn consent.

controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall specify the purpose for which personal data is being collected at the time of collection. This purpose shall be clearly communicated to the Data Principal and shall be limited to the specified purpose.

The Data Fiduciary shall only collect and process the minimum amount of personal data necessary to achieve the specified purpose. Any additional data collected shall be deleted or anonymized promptly.

The Data Fiduciary shall obtain explicit consent from the Data Principal before processing their personal data for any purpose other than the specified purpose. This consent shall be documented and retained for a minimum of 5 years.

The Data Fiduciary shall review the purpose for which personal data is being processed on a regular basis (at least annually) to ensure it remains valid and necessary. Any changes to the purpose shall be documented and communicated to the Data Principal.

The Data Fiduciary shall retain personal data for no longer than necessary to achieve the specified purpose. Personal data shall be deleted or anonymized promptly after the purpose has been fulfilled.

controls.control: Establish a clear and easily accessible mechanism for individuals to withdraw their consent for data processing. This can be achieved through a dedicated webpage, email address, or a contact form. The mechanism should be prominently displayed on the Data Fiduciary's website and communicated to individuals at the time of data collection.

Develop and implement automated processes to detect and respond to consent withdrawals in a timely manner. This can include integrating consent withdrawal mechanisms with existing data management systems to ensure seamless processing cessation.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update Consent Records
controls.control: Establish a regular review process to ensure that consent records are up-to-date and reflect any changes in individual consent status. This includes verifying the accuracy of consent withdrawal records and updating data processing activities accordingly.

Maintain a comprehensive document outlining the procedures for handling consent withdrawals, including the steps taken to cease data processing and any subsequent actions. This document should be accessible to relevant personnel and updated as necessary.

controls.control_title: Notify Affected Parties of Consent Withdrawal
controls.control: Develop and implement procedures to notify relevant parties, including data subjects and third-party service providers, of consent withdrawals and the resulting cessation of data processing. This ensures transparency and accountability in data handling practices.

controls.control_title: Establish a Personal Data Governance Policy
controls.control: Develop and implement a comprehensive policy for processing personal data in accordance with the standards set by the Central Government or any applicable law. The policy should outline the purpose, scope, and procedures for processing personal data, as well as the roles and responsibilities of personnel involved in data processing.

controls.control_title: Conduct a Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA)
controls.control: Perform a DPIA to identify and mitigate potential risks associated with processing personal data. The DPIA should consider the type of data being processed, the purpose of processing, and the potential impact on individuals. The results of the DPIA should be documented and used to inform the development of the personal data governance policy.

Appoint a DPO who will be responsible for overseeing the implementation of the personal data governance policy and ensuring compliance with applicable laws and regulations. The DPO should be independent and have the necessary expertise to perform their duties effectively.

Provide regular training and awareness programs for personnel involved in processing personal data. The training should cover the personal data governance policy, data protection laws and regulations, and the importance of data protection in the organization.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all data processing activities, including the type of data processed, the purpose of processing, and the individuals involved. These records should be used to demonstrate compliance with the personal data governance policy and applicable laws and regulations.

Conduct regular audits and reviews to ensure compliance with the personal data governance policy and applicable laws and regulations. The audits should cover all aspects of data processing, including data collection, storage, and disposal.

controls.control: Develop and implement a data governance policy that outlines the standards for processing personal data in accordance with the Central Government's policy or relevant laws. The policy should be reviewed and updated regularly to ensure compliance with changing regulations.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Training and Awareness Programs
controls.control: Provide regular training and awareness programs for employees on the data governance policy, relevant laws, and best practices for processing personal data. This will ensure that employees understand their roles and responsibilities in maintaining compliance.

controls.control_title: Maintain a Record of Personal Data Processing Activities
controls.control: Maintain a record of all personal data processing activities, including the types of data processed, the purposes of processing, and the categories of individuals affected. This will help demonstrate compliance with the data governance policy and relevant laws.

controls.control: Develop and implement a data protection policy that outlines the procedures for processing personal data in accordance with the Central Government's policy or applicable laws. The policy should be reviewed and updated regularly to ensure compliance.

Appoint a Data Protection Officer (DPO) who will be responsible for ensuring compliance with the Central Government's policy or applicable laws. The DPO should be knowledgeable about data protection regulations and procedures.

Perform regular audits to ensure that personal data is being processed in accordance with the Central Government's policy or applicable laws. The audits should cover data collection, storage, and disposal procedures.

requirement: The government shall process personal data to determine eligibility for government benefits.
requirement_description: The government must process personal data to determine eligibility for government benefits, such as other prescribed benefits.

controls.control: Collect only the minimum amount of personal data necessary to determine eligibility for government benefits. This includes name, date of birth, social security number, and relevant employment or income information.

Ensure that personal data is collected and processed only for the purpose of determining eligibility for government benefits. Do not use the data for any other purpose without explicit consent from the individual.

Verify the accuracy of personal data collected from individuals, including name, date of birth, social security number, and relevant employment or income information. Update the data as necessary to ensure its accuracy.

Establish a data retention policy that outlines how long personal data will be stored and when it will be deleted. Ensure that data is deleted when it is no longer necessary for determining eligibility for government benefits.
Provide individuals with access to their personal data collected for determining eligibility for government benefits. Allow them to correct or update their data as necessary.

Implement robust security measures to protect personal data from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, modification, or destruction. This includes encryption, access controls, and regular security audits.

controls.control_title: Data Protection by Design and Default
controls.control: Design and implement systems and processes that protect personal data by default. This includes implementing data protection measures at the outset of a project, rather than as an afterthought.

requirement: The State or its instrumentalities shall perform functions under applicable laws.
requirement_description: This requirement mandates the State or its instrumentalities to perform functions under applicable laws, prioritizing sovereignty, integrity, and security.

controls.control: Clearly define roles and responsibilities of State or its instrumentalities personnel to ensure that functions are performed in accordance with applicable laws. This includes establishing a chain of command and ensuring that personnel understand their duties and obligations.

controls.control_title: Develop and Implement Policies and Procedures
controls.control: Develop, implement, and maintain policies and procedures that outline the functions to be performed by the State or its instrumentalities. These policies and procedures should be based on applicable laws and should be communicated to all personnel involved in performing these functions.

Provide regular training and awareness programs for personnel involved in performing functions under applicable laws. This training should cover the laws, policies, and procedures related to these functions and should be tailored to the specific needs of each personnel.

Regularly monitor and review the performance of the State or its instrumentalities in performing functions under applicable laws. This includes reviewing compliance with laws, policies, and procedures and taking corrective action when necessary.

Maintain accurate and complete records of all functions performed by the State or its instrumentalities under applicable laws. This includes records of decisions, actions taken, and outcomes achieved.

Conduct regular audits and assessments to ensure that the State or its instrumentalities are performing functions under applicable laws in accordance with laws, policies, and procedures. This includes reviewing compliance with laws, policies, and procedures and identifying areas for improvement.

requirement: Personal data shall be disclosed to the State or its instrumentalities as per applicable laws.

controls.control: Establish a clear data disclosure policy that outlines the procedures for disclosing personal data to the State or its instrumentalities as per applicable laws. The policy should be communicated to all employees and stakeholders.
Implement role-based access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to personal data. This includes implementing segregation of duties and least privilege access principles.

Establish a process for handling data disclosure requests from the State or its instrumentalities. This includes verifying the authenticity of the request, ensuring that the request is in compliance with applicable laws, and disclosing the data in a secure manner.

Notify individuals whose personal data is being disclosed to the State or its instrumentalities, as required by applicable laws. This includes providing them with information about the disclosure, the purpose of the disclosure, and their rights under applicable laws.

Implement a data retention and disposal policy that ensures personal data is retained for the minimum period required by applicable laws and then disposed of securely. This includes implementing a data archiving and deletion process.
Implement logging and auditing mechanisms to track all data disclosure requests and responses. This includes logging the date, time, and details of the request, as well as the response provided.

requirement: Organizations shall comply with judgments, decrees, and orders issued under applicable laws.

controls.control: Develop and implement a comprehensive compliance program that includes policies, procedures, and training to ensure adherence to judgments, decrees, and orders issued under applicable laws. Appoint a compliance officer who is responsible for ensuring that the organization complies with judgments, decrees, and orders issued under applicable laws. The compliance officer should have the authority to investigate and address any compliance issues.

Establish a system to monitor and report compliance with judgments, decrees, and orders issued under applicable laws. The system should include regular reporting to management and the board of directors on compliance status and any issues identified.

requirement: Organizations shall respond to medical emergencies involving a threat to life or health.
requirement_description: This requirement mandates organizations to respond to medical emergencies involving a threat to life or health, prioritizing the safety and well-being of individuals.

controls.control: Develop and implement a comprehensive emergency response plan that outlines procedures for responding to medical emergencies involving a threat to life or health. The plan should include clear roles and responsibilities, communication protocols, and evacuation procedures.

Identify and train a team of employees who will respond to medical emergencies. This team should include individuals with first aid and CPR training, as well as those with experience in emergency response.

controls.control_title: Provide First Aid and CPR Training
controls.control: Offer regular first aid and CPR training to all employees, including those who may not be part of the emergency response team. This training should be provided at least annually and should cover basic life support techniques.

controls.control_title: Maintain a List of Emergency Contacts
controls.control: Create a list of emergency contacts, including local hospitals, emergency services, and other relevant organizations. This list should be easily accessible to all employees and should be reviewed and updated regularly.

Post emergency response procedures in a visible location, such as near the entrance of the facility or in a break room. This will help ensure that all employees are aware of the procedures and can quickly access them in the event of an emergency.
Conduct regular emergency response drills to ensure that employees are familiar with the emergency response plan and can respond quickly and effectively in the event of an emergency.

requirement: Organizations shall provide medical treatment and health services during public health emergencies.
requirement_description: This requirement mandates organizations to provide medical treatment and health services during public health emergencies, such as epidemics or outbreaks of disease.

controls.control: Develop and implement a comprehensive crisis management plan that outlines procedures for providing medical treatment and health services during public health emergencies. The plan should include emergency contact information, evacuation procedures, and communication protocols.

controls.control_title: Maintain a Stockpile of Medical Supplies
controls.control: Ensure that a sufficient stockpile of medical supplies, including personal protective equipment (PPE), medications, and medical equipment, is maintained to meet the needs of employees and the public during a public health emergency.
Provide regular training and education for healthcare workers on emergency response procedures, infection control, and the use of personal protective equipment (PPE).

Establish clear communication protocols for sharing information with employees, the public, and other stakeholders during a public health emergency. This includes regular updates on the status of the emergency, instructions for self-isolation or quarantine, and information on available resources.

Conduct regular emergency drills to test the effectiveness of the crisis management plan and identify areas for improvement. This includes drills for evacuation procedures, communication protocols, and the use of medical supplies.

controls.control_title: Maintain a Public Health Emergency Response Team
controls.control: Establish a public health emergency response team that includes representatives from various departments, including healthcare, communications, and facilities management. This team should be responsible for coordinating the organization's response to a public health emergency.

requirement_description: This requirement mandates organizations to ensure safety and provide assistance during disasters and public order breakdowns, prioritizing the well-being of individuals.

controls.control: Develop and regularly update an emergency response plan that outlines procedures for responding to disasters and public order breakdowns. The plan should include evacuation procedures, communication protocols, and roles and responsibilities for emergency response teams.

Maintain up-to-date emergency contact information for all employees, including phone numbers, email addresses, and emergency contact details. This information should be easily accessible to emergency response teams.

Conduct regular emergency drills and training sessions for employees to ensure they are familiar with emergency procedures and protocols. This should include training on evacuation procedures, first aid, and communication protocols.
Ensure that emergency equipment and supplies, such as fire extinguishers, first aid kits, and emergency lighting, are readily available and easily accessible in case of an emergency.
Establish communication channels with stakeholders, including employees, customers, and emergency services, to provide updates and information during emergencies and public order breakdowns.

controls.control_title: Review and Revision of Emergency Procedures
controls.control: Regularly review and revise emergency procedures and protocols to ensure they remain effective and up-to-date. This should include reviewing lessons learned from previous emergencies and incorporating feedback from employees and stakeholders.

requirement: Organizations shall implement safeguards for employment-related purposes, including prevention of corporate espionage and maintenance of confidentiality.
requirement_description: This requirement mandates organizations to implement safeguards for employment-related purposes, including the prevention of corporate espionage and the maintenance of confidentiality of trade secrets, intellectual property, and classified information.

controls.control: Conduct thorough background checks on all employees, including verification of employment history, education, and personal references, to prevent hiring individuals with malicious intent.
Implement and enforce NDAs for all employees, contractors, and third-party vendors to maintain confidentiality of sensitive information and prevent corporate espionage.
Implement a robust access control system to restrict access to sensitive information and systems based on job function and need-to-know principles, and regularly review and update access permissions.
Encrypt sensitive information both in transit and at rest, and store it in secure, access-controlled locations to prevent unauthorized access and data breaches.

Provide regular training and awareness programs for employees on the importance of confidentiality, data protection, and corporate espionage prevention, and ensure they understand their roles and responsibilities in maintaining confidentiality.

Develop and implement an incident response plan to quickly respond to and contain any security incidents or data breaches, and ensure that all employees know their roles and responsibilities in responding to such incidents.

requirement: A Data Fiduciary shall be responsible for complying with the provisions of this Act and the rules made thereunder.
requirement_description: Data Fiduciaries are accountable for ensuring compliance with the Act and its rules, regardless of agreements or actions by Data Principals.

controls.control: Develop and implement a comprehensive compliance program that outlines the Data Fiduciary's responsibilities and obligations under the Act and its rules. The program should include policies, procedures, and training for employees to ensure adherence to the Act's provisions.

Appoint a qualified individual as the Compliance Officer who will be responsible for overseeing the compliance program, monitoring compliance, and reporting any non-compliance to the Data Fiduciary's management.

Provide regular training and awareness programs for employees to educate them on the Act's provisions, the Data Fiduciary's compliance program, and their roles and responsibilities in maintaining compliance.

Establish a system to monitor and report compliance with the Act's provisions, including regular audits, risk assessments, and incident reporting. The Data Fiduciary should also maintain records of compliance activities and incidents.

Keep accurate and up-to-date records of compliance activities, including training programs, audits, and incident reports. The Data Fiduciary should also maintain records of its compliance program, policies, and procedures.

Establish a process for reporting and addressing non-compliance with the Act's provisions. The Data Fiduciary should investigate and address any incidents of non-compliance promptly and take corrective action to prevent future occurrences.

requirement: A Data Fiduciary must engage a Data Processor under a valid contract.
requirement_description: Data Fiduciaries must have a valid contract in place when engaging a Data Processor to process personal data.

controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must engage a Data Processor under a valid contract that includes provisions for data protection, confidentiality, and security. The contract must be signed by authorized representatives of both parties and must be reviewed and updated regularly to ensure compliance with changing regulations and requirements.

The contract with the Data Processor must include specific requirements for data protection, such as encryption, access controls, and data backup procedures. The contract must also specify the responsibilities of both parties in the event of a data breach or other security incident.

The contract with the Data Processor must include provisions for data confidentiality, including requirements for non-disclosure and non-use of sensitive data. The contract must also specify the consequences of a breach of confidentiality.

The contract with the Data Processor must include requirements for data security, such as firewalls, intrusion detection and prevention systems, and regular security audits. The contract must also specify the responsibilities of both parties in maintaining the security of the data.

controls.control_title: Contractual Requirements for Data Return and Deletion
controls.control: The contract with the Data Processor must include provisions for the return and deletion of data at the end of the contract or in the event of a termination. The contract must specify the procedures for data return and deletion, including the use of secure methods to ensure the integrity of the data.
