controls.control: Develop a clear and comprehensive framework to classify breaches based on their nature, gravity, and duration. This framework should be communicated to all relevant stakeholders and updated regularly to reflect changing business needs and regulatory requirements.

Establish a process to identify and assess the potential impacts of a breach on the organization, including financial, reputational, and operational impacts. This assessment should be conducted in a timely manner and take into account the nature, gravity, and duration of the breach.

Develop a comprehensive breach response plan that outlines the steps to be taken in the event of a breach. The plan should include procedures for containment, eradication, recovery, and post-incident activities, as well as a process for communicating with stakeholders and regulatory bodies.

Maintain a record of all breaches, including the nature, gravity, and duration of each breach. This record should be used to identify trends and areas for improvement, and to inform the development of the breach classification framework and breach response plan.

controls.control_title: Establish a Breach Review and Improvement Process
controls.control: Establish a process to review and improve the organization's breach response and management practices. This process should include regular reviews of breach incidents, identification of areas for improvement, and implementation of changes to prevent similar breaches from occurring in the future.

controls.control: Develop and implement a clear framework for classifying data breaches based on the type and nature of personal data affected. This framework should consider factors such as sensitivity, confidentiality, and potential impact on individuals.

controls.control_title: Train Staff on Breach Classification and Response

Regularly conduct risk assessments to identify potential data breaches and evaluate the effectiveness of existing controls. This will help the organization to proactively address vulnerabilities and improve its overall data protection posture.

requirement_description: The Board must take into account whether the breach was a one-time incident or a recurring issue when determining the monetary penalty.

controls.control: The Board shall review breach reports on a regular basis to identify patterns and repetitive nature of breaches. This review shall be conducted at least quarterly and shall include analysis of breach types, frequency, and impact.

The organization shall implement a breach tracking system to monitor and record all breaches, including the date, time, type, and impact of each breach. This system shall be used to identify repetitive breaches and inform the Board's review process.

The organization shall document the root causes of each breach, including any contributing factors or patterns. This documentation shall be used to inform the Board's review process and identify areas for improvement.

The Board shall develop a breach prevention strategy that addresses the repetitive nature of breaches identified through the review process. This strategy shall include measures to prevent or mitigate future breaches and shall be reviewed and updated regularly.

The organization shall provide regular training to employees on breach prevention and the importance of identifying and reporting repetitive breaches. This training shall be conducted at least annually and shall include scenario-based exercises to test employees' knowledge and response to breaches.

requirement: The Board shall consider whether the person gained or avoided a loss due to the breach.
requirement_description: The Board must consider whether the person benefited financially or avoided losses as a result of the breach when determining the monetary penalty.

controls.control: The Board shall conduct a thorough financial analysis to determine the financial impact of the breach, including any gains or losses incurred by the individual or organization. This analysis should consider all relevant financial data, including but not limited to, revenue, expenses, assets, and liabilities.

The Board shall review all relevant financial records and statements to identify any discrepancies or irregularities that may be related to the breach. This review should include but not be limited to, bank statements, investment records, and tax returns.

controls.control_title: Document the financial impact of the breach
controls.control: The Board shall document the financial impact of the breach, including any gains or losses incurred by the individual or organization. This documentation should be maintained in a secure and accessible location for future reference.

controls.control_title: Conduct an investigation into the breach
controls.control: The Board shall conduct a thorough investigation into the breach to determine the root cause and identify any individuals or groups responsible. This investigation should consider all relevant evidence, including but not limited to, security logs, network traffic, and witness statements.

The Board shall review all relevant security policies and procedures to identify any weaknesses or vulnerabilities that may have contributed to the breach. This review should consider all relevant security controls, including but not limited to, access controls, authentication, and encryption.

The Board shall update all relevant security policies and procedures to prevent similar breaches from occurring in the future. This update should consider all relevant security controls, including but not limited to, access controls, authentication, and encryption.

Develop and implement procedures for notifying stakeholders, including the board, of a breach, including the timing and content of notifications. Ensure that notifications are made in a timely and transparent manner.

Conduct regular risk assessments to identify potential vulnerabilities and implement controls to mitigate those risks. This includes identifying and addressing potential weaknesses in systems and processes that could be exploited by an attacker.

Implement monitoring and detection controls to identify potential breaches in a timely manner. This includes implementing intrusion detection systems, log analysis, and other controls to detect and respond to potential breaches.

Conduct a thorough review of the breach, including the root cause, impact, and effectiveness of the response. This review should be used to identify areas for improvement and implement changes to prevent similar breaches in the future.

controls.control: Develop and implement a clear framework for determining monetary penalties, including criteria for proportionality and effectiveness. This framework should be regularly reviewed and updated to ensure it remains relevant and effective.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Reviews of Monetary Penalties
controls.control: Schedule regular reviews of monetary penalties to ensure they remain proportionate and effective. These reviews should be conducted by a designated committee or individual and should include input from relevant stakeholders.

Maintain a record of the rationale behind each monetary penalty, including the factors considered and the evidence used to support the decision. This documentation should be readily available for review and audit purposes.

controls.control_title: Provide Training on Monetary Penalty Framework
controls.control: Provide training to relevant staff on the monetary penalty framework, including the criteria for proportionality and effectiveness. This training should be conducted on a regular basis to ensure staff are aware of any changes to the framework.

controls.control_title: Monitor and Report on Monetary Penalty Effectiveness
controls.control: Establish a process for monitoring and reporting on the effectiveness of monetary penalties. This should include tracking the impact of penalties on behavior and making adjustments to the framework as necessary.

controls.control_title: Establish a Monetary Penalty Impact Assessment Process
controls.control: Develop a formal process to assess the likely impact of a monetary penalty on the person. This process should consider factors such as financial stability, business continuity, and potential long-term effects. The process should be documented and communicated to all relevant stakeholders.

controls.control_title: Identify and Document Potential Monetary Penalty Impacts
controls.control: Identify potential scenarios where a monetary penalty may be imposed and document the likely impacts on the person. This should include financial projections, business continuity plans, and potential long-term effects. The documentation should be regularly reviewed and updated to reflect changes in the business or regulatory environment.

controls.control_title: Provide Training on Monetary Penalty Impact Assessment
controls.control: Provide regular training to employees on the process of assessing the likely impact of a monetary penalty on the person. This training should cover the factors to consider, the process to follow, and the importance of accurate and timely assessments. The training should be documented and evaluated to ensure its effectiveness.

controls.control_title: Establish a Monetary Penalty Escalation Procedure
controls.control: Develop a formal procedure for escalating concerns about the likely impact of a monetary penalty on the person. This procedure should include clear communication channels, defined decision-making authorities, and a clear timeline for action. The procedure should be documented and communicated to all relevant stakeholders.

controls.control_title: Monitor and Review Monetary Penalty Impacts
controls.control: Regularly monitor and review the likely impact of monetary penalties on the person. This should include tracking financial performance, business continuity, and potential long-term effects. The review should be documented and used to inform future assessments and decision-making.

controls.control: Implement an automated process to credit all penalty amounts to the Consolidated Fund of India, ensuring timely and accurate crediting of funds.

35. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceedings shall lie against the Central
Government, the Board, its Chairperson and any Member, officer or employee thereof for
anything which is done or intended to be done in good faith under the provisions of this
Act or the rules made thereunder.
36. The Central Government may, for the purposes of this Act, require the Board and
any Data Fiduciary or intermediary to furnish such information as it may call for.
 37. (1) The Central Government or any of its officers specially authorised by it in this
behalf may, upon receipt of a reference in writing from the Board that—
(a) intimates the imposition of monetary penalty by the Board on a Data Fiduciary
in two or more instances; and
(b) advises, in the interests of the general public, the blocking for access by the
public to any information generated, transmitted, received, stored or hosted, in any
computer resource that enables such Data Fiduciary to carry on any activity relating
to offering of goods or services to Data Principals within the territory of India,
after giving an opportunity of being heard to that Data Fiduciary, on being satisfied that it
is necessary or expedient so to do, in the interests of the general public, for reasons to be
recorded in writing, by order, direct any agency of the Central Government or any intermediary
to block for access by the public or cause to be blocked for access by the public any such
information.
(2) Every intermediary who receives a direction issued under sub-section (1) shall be
bound to comply with the same.
(3) For the purposes of this section, the expressions “computer resource”,
“information” and “intermediary” shall have the meanings respectively assigned to them in
the Information Technology Act, 2000.

requirement: The Central Government, the Board, its Chairperson and any Member, officer or employee thereof shall not be liable for actions taken in good faith.
requirement_description: This requirement protects the Central Government, the Board, and its employees from legal consequences for actions taken in good faith under the Act or its rules.

controls.control_title: Good Faith Clause in Policies and Procedures
controls.control: Establish a policy that clearly outlines the good faith clause and ensures that all employees, officers, and members are aware of it. This policy should be communicated to all stakeholders and included in employee handbooks and training programs.

Develop and implement regular training programs for employees, officers, and members to educate them on the good faith clause and its implications. This training should be mandatory and include case studies and scenarios to reinforce the concept.

controls.control_title: Good Faith Clause in Contracts and Agreements
controls.control: Ensure that all contracts and agreements entered into by the Central Government, the Board, its Chairperson, and any Member, officer, or employee include a good faith clause. This clause should be clearly defined and understood by all parties involved.

Maintain a record of all decisions made in good faith, including the rationale behind them. This documentation should be kept for a minimum of 5 years and made available for audit or review as needed.

Establish a system for reporting and investigating any allegations of bad faith or negligence. This system should include clear procedures for reporting, investigating, and addressing any incidents, and should ensure that all parties involved are held accountable for their actions.

The organization shall designate a Disclosure Officer responsible for ensuring compliance with the disclosure requirements. This officer shall be authorized to access all necessary information and resources to fulfill their duties.

The organization shall develop a procedure for disclosing information as required by the Central Government. This procedure shall outline the steps to be taken, the information to be disclosed, and the timelines for disclosure.

The organization shall provide regular training to employees on the disclosure requirements and the procedures for disclosing information. This training shall ensure that employees understand their roles and responsibilities in complying with the disclosure requirements.

The organization shall maintain a register of all disclosures made as required by the Central Government. This register shall include details of the information disclosed, the date of disclosure, and the recipient of the disclosure.

The organization shall conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with the disclosure requirements. These audits shall review the disclosure procedures, the accuracy of disclosures, and the effectiveness of the Disclosure Officer's role.

controls.control: Implement an automated system to track penalties imposed on Data Fiduciaries. The system should be able to identify when a Data Fiduciary has been penalized twice and flag it for further review.

Establish a clear framework to assess whether blocking information is in the public interest. This framework should consider factors such as national security, public safety, and the potential impact on individuals or groups.

Conduct regular audits and reviews to ensure that the automated system is functioning correctly and that penalties are being tracked accurately. This should include reviews of the public interest assessment framework to ensure it is being applied consistently and fairly.

Maintain accurate and detailed records of all penalties imposed on Data Fiduciaries, including the reasons for the penalties and any subsequent actions taken. This will help to ensure transparency and accountability in the process.

Establish a process for notifying Data Fiduciaries when they have been penalized twice and information is being blocked. This should include clear communication of the reasons for the block and any steps that can be taken to resolve the issue.

35. No suit, prosecution or other legal proceedings shall lie against the Central
Government, the Board, its Chairperson and any Member, officer or employee thereof for
anything which is done or intended to be done in good faith under the provisions of this
Act or the rules made thereunder.
36. The Central Government may, for the purposes of this Act, require the Board and
any Data Fiduciary or intermediary to furnish such information as it may call for.
 37. (1) The Central Government or any of its officers specially authorised by it in this
behalf may, upon receipt of a reference in writing from the Board that—
(a) intimates the imposition of monetary penalty by the Board on a Data Fiduciary
in two or more instances; and
(b) advises, in the interests of the general public, the blocking for access by the
public to any information generated, transmitted, received, stored or hosted, in any
computer resource that enables such Data Fiduciary to carry on any activity relating
to offering of goods or services to Data Principals within the territory of India,
after giving an opportunity of being heard to that Data Fiduciary, on being satisfied that it
is necessary or expedient so to do, in the interests of the general public, for reasons to be
recorded in writing, by order, direct any agency of the Central Government or any intermediary
to block for access by the public or cause to be blocked for access by the public any such
information.
(2) Every intermediary who receives a direction issued under sub-section (1) shall be
bound to comply with the same.
(3) For the purposes of this section, the expressions “computer resource”,
“information” and “intermediary” shall have the meanings respectively assigned to them in
the Information Technology Act, 2000.

requirement: Intermediaries shall comply with directions issued by the Central Government or its officers.
requirement_description: This requirement obliges intermediaries to comply with directions issued by the Central Government or its officers.

controls.control: Intermediaries shall establish clear communication channels with the Central Government or its officers to receive and respond to directions in a timely manner. This includes designating a primary point of contact and ensuring that all relevant personnel are aware of the communication protocols.

controls.control_title: Implement Direction Receipt and Acknowledgement Process
controls.control: Intermediaries shall implement a process to receive, acknowledge, and record all directions issued by the Central Government or its officers. This includes maintaining a record of all directions received and the actions taken in response.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Training and Awareness Programs
controls.control: Intermediaries shall conduct regular training and awareness programs for all personnel involved in receiving and responding to directions from the Central Government or its officers. This includes training on the procedures for receiving and responding to directions, as well as the importance of compliance.

Intermediaries shall maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation related to directions received from the Central Government or its officers. This includes maintaining records of all directions received, actions taken, and outcomes.

Intermediaries shall designate a compliance officer who is responsible for ensuring that all directions issued by the Central Government or its officers are received, acknowledged, and implemented in a timely manner. The compliance officer shall be responsible for monitoring compliance and reporting any issues to the Central Government or its officers.

requirement: Sums realised by way of penalties shall be credited to the Consolidated Fund of India.
requirement_description: Organizations must credit any penalties received to the Consolidated Fund of India.

controls.control: Establish a clear and documented process for crediting sums realised by way of penalties to the Consolidated Fund of India. This process should include clear roles and responsibilities, timelines, and approval mechanisms.

Implement a robust and automated system for crediting sums realised by way of penalties to the Consolidated Fund of India. This system should be integrated with existing financial management systems and should provide real-time tracking and reporting.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of all penalty sums credited to the Consolidated Fund of India, including details of the penalty, the amount credited, and the date of crediting.

Conduct regular audits to ensure that sums realised by way of penalties are being credited to the Consolidated Fund of India in accordance with the established process and procedures. These audits should be conducted by an independent third-party auditor.

Provide regular training to all personnel involved in the crediting of sums realised by way of penalties to the Consolidated Fund of India. This training should cover the established process and procedures, as well as the importance of accurate and timely crediting.

requirement: Action taken in good faith shall be protected.
requirement_description: Organizations are protected from liability for actions taken in good faith.

controls.control: Develop and implement a policy that clearly defines what actions are taken in good faith and how they will be protected. The policy should be communicated to all employees and stakeholders.

Appoint a Good Faith Officer who will be responsible for overseeing the implementation of the good faith policy and ensuring that actions taken in good faith are protected. The Good Faith Officer should be a senior-level employee with the authority to make decisions and take actions.

Provide regular training to employees on the good faith policy and the importance of taking actions in good faith. The training should cover what actions are considered good faith and how to handle situations where an action may be questioned.

Maintain a record of all actions taken in good faith, including the reason for the action and any supporting documentation. This will help to demonstrate that actions were taken in good faith and provide evidence in case of a dispute.

controls.control_title: Review and Update Good Faith Policy
controls.control: Regularly review and update the good faith policy to ensure it remains effective and relevant. This should be done at least annually, or as needed, to reflect changes in the organization or industry.

controls.control_title: Implement a Clear Information Request Process
controls.control: Establish a well-documented process for requesting and providing information to stakeholders. This process should include clear guidelines on who to contact, how to submit requests, and expected response times.

controls.control_title: Designate an Information Request Point of Contact
controls.control: Appoint a specific individual or team to serve as the primary point of contact for information requests. This person should be responsible for receiving, processing, and responding to requests in a timely manner.

Maintain a record of all information requests, including the date received, requestor's details, and response provided. This documentation will help track trends, identify areas for improvement, and facilitate compliance audits.

controls.control_title: Ensure Information Requesters are Aware of Response Times
controls.control: Clearly communicate expected response times to information requesters, and provide regular updates on the status of their requests. This will help manage expectations and maintain transparency throughout the process.

controls.control_title: Establish a Feedback Mechanism for Information Requests
controls.control: Implement a feedback loop to gather insights from information requesters on the quality and timeliness of responses. This will help identify areas for improvement and inform process enhancements.

requirement: Directions shall be issued by the Central Government.
requirement_description: The Central Government has the authority to issue directions to organizations.

controls.control: The Central Government shall establish a clear and documented process for issuing directions. This process shall include clear roles and responsibilities, timelines, and approval mechanisms to ensure that directions are issued in a timely and effective manner.

The Central Government shall define clear criteria for issuing directions, including the types of situations that warrant direction issuance, the level of authority required, and the expected outcomes. These criteria shall be documented and communicated to all relevant stakeholders.

The Central Government shall maintain accurate and complete records of all directions issued, including the date, time, and content of the direction, as well as any subsequent actions taken in response to the direction. These records shall be stored securely and made available for audit and review purposes.

The Central Government shall ensure that all directions issued comply with relevant laws, regulations, and policies. This shall include conducting regular reviews and audits to ensure that directions are issued in accordance with established procedures and that any non-compliance is addressed promptly.

The Central Government shall communicate clearly and effectively with all relevant stakeholders regarding direction issuance, including the purpose, scope, and expected outcomes of the direction. This shall include providing timely and accurate information to stakeholders, as well as ensuring that they understand their roles and responsibilities in implementing the direction.

requirement_description: This requirement ensures that the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023, does not supersede or contradict existing laws.

controls.control: Regularly review and update existing laws and regulations to ensure they are in compliance with the provisions of this Act. This includes identifying any gaps or inconsistencies and taking corrective action to address them.

controls.control: Include a clear and explicit clause in the Act that prohibits the granting of injunctions against actions taken under the Act. This clause should be prominently displayed and easily accessible to all stakeholders.

Establish a clear review process for any injunction requests related to actions taken under the Act. This process should include clear criteria for evaluating the validity of the request and a timeline for making a decision.

Require that any party seeking an injunction against an action under the Act must provide written notification to the relevant authorities and stakeholders at least 30 days prior to filing the injunction request. This will provide sufficient time for review and consideration of the request.

Provide regular training and education to judges and other judicial officials on the provisions of the Act and the prohibition on granting injunctions. This will ensure that they are aware of the Act's requirements and can make informed decisions.

Develop a standardized form for requesting an injunction against an action under the Act. This form should include clear and concise information about the request, including the grounds for the request and any supporting evidence.

controls.control: The notice given by the Data Fiduciary to a Data Principal shall be written in clear and concise language, avoiding technical jargon and complex terminology that may be difficult for the Data Principal to understand.
The notice shall be written in plain language, using simple and straightforward language that is easy to understand, and avoiding ambiguity or confusion.
The notice shall be presented in a clear and organized format, with headings, subheadings, and bullet points to facilitate easy reading and understanding.

The notice shall be provided to the Data Principal in a timely manner, prior to the collection, use, or disclosure of their personal data, and at least 30 days prior to any changes to the data processing practices.

The Data Fiduciary shall provide multiple channels for the Data Principal to receive the notice, including email, postal mail, and online notifications, to ensure that the notice is accessible to all Data Principals.
The Data Fiduciary shall maintain a record of all notices provided to Data Principals, including the date, time, and method of delivery, to demonstrate compliance with this requirement.

controls.control: Clearly define the roles and responsibilities of the Consent Manager, including their obligations and accountabilities, to ensure transparency and understanding of their duties.

Develop and implement an accountability framework that outlines the Consent Manager's obligations, including the collection, storage, and processing of personal data, to ensure compliance with regulations.
Maintain up-to-date documentation of the Consent Manager's obligations, including their roles, responsibilities, and accountabilities, to ensure easy access and understanding of their duties.
Regularly conduct audits and reviews of the Consent Manager's activities to ensure compliance with regulations and to identify areas for improvement.
Provide regular training and support to the Consent Manager to ensure they have the necessary knowledge and skills to perform their duties effectively and in compliance with regulations.

Develop and implement an incident response plan that outlines the procedures to be followed in the event of a data breach or other incident involving the Consent Manager, to ensure prompt and effective response.

requirement: Rules shall be made for the registration of Consent Manager.
requirement_description: This requirement allows the Central Government to make rules for the registration of Consent Managers.

controls.control_title: Define Clear Consent Manager Registration Rules
controls.control: Establish clear rules and guidelines for the registration of Consent Manager, including the required information and documentation, to ensure consistency and accuracy in the registration process.
Develop and implement automated validation checks to ensure that the registration information provided for Consent Manager is accurate and complete, reducing the risk of errors and inconsistencies.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Review of Consent Manager Registration Rules
controls.control: Schedule regular reviews of the Consent Manager registration rules to ensure they remain relevant, effective, and aligned with changing business needs and regulatory requirements.

controls.control_title: Assign Accountability for Consent Manager Registration
controls.control: Clearly define and assign accountability for the Consent Manager registration process, including roles and responsibilities, to ensure that someone is ultimately responsible for the accuracy and completeness of the registration information.

controls.control_title: Provide Training on Consent Manager Registration Rules
controls.control: Provide regular training and awareness programs for personnel involved in the Consent Manager registration process to ensure they understand the rules, guidelines, and procedures.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of the Consent Manager registration process, including procedures, guidelines, and decision-making criteria, to facilitate understanding and compliance.

requirement: Rules shall be made for the form and manner of intimation of personal data breach.
requirement_description: This requirement allows the Central Government to make rules for the form and manner of intimation of personal data breaches.

controls.control_title: Establish a Personal Data Breach Response Plan
controls.control: Develop a comprehensive response plan that outlines the procedures to be followed in the event of a personal data breach. The plan should include incident classification, notification procedures, and communication protocols.

Appoint a DPO who will be responsible for overseeing the organization's data protection practices and ensuring compliance with data breach notification requirements. The DPO should be knowledgeable about data protection laws and regulations.

controls.control_title: Develop a Personal Data Breach Notification Policy
controls.control: Create a policy that outlines the procedures for notifying affected individuals, regulatory bodies, and other stakeholders in the event of a personal data breach. The policy should include the types of breaches that require notification, the timing of notifications, and the content of notifications.

controls.control_title: Establish a Breach Notification Communication Plan
controls.control: Develop a plan that outlines the communication procedures to be followed in the event of a personal data breach. This plan should include the channels of communication, the content of notifications, and the timing of notifications.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Training and Awareness Programs
controls.control: Provide regular training and awareness programs for employees on the organization's data protection policies and procedures, including the procedures for reporting and responding to personal data breaches.

controls.control_title: Maintain a Record of Personal Data Breaches
controls.control: Keep a record of all personal data breaches, including the date and time of the breach, the type of breach, the number of individuals affected, and the actions taken to respond to the breach.

requirement: Rules shall be made for the time period for the specified purpose to be deemed as no longer being served.
requirement_description: This requirement allows the Central Government to make rules for the time period for the specified purpose to be deemed as no longer being served.

controls.control: Develop and document a clear policy for determining when a rule or purpose is no longer being served, including specific timeframes and criteria for evaluation. This policy should be communicated to all stakeholders and updated regularly.

Identify and document key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics that will be used to evaluate the effectiveness of a rule or purpose. These metrics should be regularly reviewed and updated as necessary.
Schedule regular reviews of rules and purposes to determine if they are still being served. This review should be conducted at least annually, or more frequently if circumstances change.

When a rule or purpose is deemed no longer being served, document the rationale for its removal, including any relevant data or analysis that supported the decision. This documentation should be retained for future reference.
Notify all stakeholders of changes to rules or purposes, including the reasons for the change and any expected impacts. This communication should be timely and transparent.

requirement_title: Time period for specified purpose to be deemed as no longer being served
requirement: The time period for a specified purpose to be deemed as no longer being served shall be determined under sub-section (8) of section 8.
requirement_description: Organizations must determine the time period for a specified purpose to be deemed as no longer being served, as per sub-section (8) of section 8.

controls.control: Establish a clear policy that outlines the retention period for each purpose, including the criteria for determining when data is no longer needed. This policy should be communicated to all stakeholders and updated regularly.

controls.control_title: Implement Data Archiving and Purging Process
controls.control: Develop and implement a process for archiving and purging data that is no longer needed. This process should be automated where possible and include regular reviews to ensure data is not retained longer than necessary.

Maintain a record of all decisions regarding data retention, including the purpose, retention period, and date of deletion. This documentation will help ensure transparency and accountability in data management.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update Retention Periods
controls.control: Schedule regular reviews of retention periods to ensure they remain relevant and compliant with regulatory requirements. This may involve updating policies, procedures, and documentation as needed.

controls.control_title: Train Staff on Data Retention Policies
controls.control: Provide regular training to staff on data retention policies and procedures, including the importance of adhering to retention periods and the consequences of non-compliance.

requirement_title: Manner of publishing business contact information of a Data Protection Officer
requirement: The business contact information of a Data Protection Officer shall be published in a manner specified under sub-section (9) of section 8.
requirement_description: Organizations must publish the business contact information of a Data Protection Officer in a manner specified under sub-section (9) of section 8.

controls.control_title: Publish Business Contact Information of DPO
controls.control: The business contact information of the Data Protection Officer (DPO) shall be published on the organization's website, in a clear and easily accessible manner, as specified under sub-section (9) of section 8. This includes the DPO's name, title, email address, and contact phone number.

controls.control_title: Regular Review and Update of Published Information
controls.control: The organization shall regularly review and update the published business contact information of the DPO to ensure its accuracy and completeness. This includes verifying the DPO's contact details and ensuring that the published information is up-to-date and reflects any changes to the DPO's role or contact information.

The organization shall maintain documentation of the method used to publish the business contact information of the DPO, including the date and time of publication, the method used (e.g. website update, email notification), and any relevant screenshots or records of the publication.

The organization shall provide training to relevant personnel on the requirements for publishing the business contact information of the DPO, including the specific details to be published and the method of publication. This training shall be provided to ensure that all personnel understand their roles and responsibilities in maintaining accurate and up-to-date publication of the DPO's contact information.

requirement: Verifiable consent shall be obtained in a manner specified under sub-section (1) of section 9.
requirement_description: Organizations must obtain verifiable consent in a manner specified under sub-section (1) of section 9.

controls.control: Obtain explicit consent from individuals before collecting, processing, or sharing their personal data. This consent must be freely given, specific, informed, and unambiguous.

Provide clear and concise options for individuals to give or withdraw their consent. This includes providing a clear description of the data being collected, the purposes of collection, and the potential consequences of not providing consent.

Maintain a record of all consent mechanisms used to obtain verifiable consent. This includes documentation of the consent process, the date and time of consent, and the individual's consent preferences.

Regularly review and update consent processes to ensure they remain compliant with the latest regulations and industry standards. This includes reviewing consent mechanisms, documentation, and communication with individuals.

Regularly verify that consent mechanisms are functioning correctly and that individuals are able to provide or withdraw their consent easily. This includes testing consent mechanisms, monitoring consent rates, and addressing any issues that arise.

Clearly communicate consent requirements to individuals, including the types of data being collected, the purposes of collection, and the potential consequences of not providing consent. This includes providing transparent and accessible information about consent.

requirement_title: Classes of Data Fiduciaries, purposes of processing of personal data of a child, and conditions
requirement: Data Fiduciaries shall process personal data of a child for specified purposes and under specified conditions, as per sub-section (4) of section 9.
requirement_description: Organizations must process personal data of a child for specified purposes and under specified conditions, as per sub-section (4) of section 9.

controls.control: Data Fiduciaries must obtain explicit parental consent before processing personal data of a child. This consent must be obtained through a secure and verifiable process, such as a digital consent form or a physical consent letter. The consent must clearly state the purposes for which the data will be processed and the conditions under which it will be stored.

Data Fiduciaries must implement a robust age verification process to ensure that the personal data being processed belongs to a child. This can be achieved through the use of age verification tools, such as ID verification services or age-gating mechanisms. The verification process must be secure and reliable to prevent unauthorized access to children's data.

Data Fiduciaries must clearly specify the purposes for which the personal data of a child will be processed and the conditions under which it will be stored. This information must be transparently communicated to parents and children, and must be easily accessible through the Data Fiduciary's website or other channels.

Data Fiduciaries must maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all processing activities related to the personal data of children. This includes records of parental consent, age verification, and data storage and processing activities. These records must be securely stored and made available to regulatory authorities upon request.

Data Fiduciaries must implement data protection by design principles when processing personal data of children. This includes considering data minimization, data anonymization, and pseudonymization techniques to minimize the risk of data breaches and unauthorized access.

requirement_title: Process of Data Protection Impact Assessment
requirement: The process of Data Protection Impact Assessment shall include other matters specified under sub-clause (i) of clause (c) of sub-section (2) of section 10.
requirement_description: Organizations must conduct a Data Protection Impact Assessment that includes other matters specified under sub-clause (i) of clause (c) of sub-section (2) of section 10.

controls.control_title: Define Scope and Objectives of DPIA
controls.control: Establish a clear scope and objectives for the Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA) process. This includes identifying the type of data being processed, the purpose of processing, and the potential risks associated with it. The scope and objectives should be documented and communicated to all relevant stakeholders.

controls.control_title: Identify and Assess Data Processing Activities
controls.control: Conduct a thorough analysis of the data processing activities to be assessed. This includes identifying the types of data being processed, the systems and technologies used, and the potential risks associated with each activity. The assessment should consider the likelihood and potential impact of data breaches or other security incidents.

Consult with relevant stakeholders, including data subjects, employees, and other interested parties, to gather their views and concerns about the data processing activities. This includes considering their perspectives on the potential risks and benefits of the activities and identifying any potential mitigation strategies.

Document the DPIA process and findings, including the scope and objectives, the assessment of data processing activities, and the results of stakeholder consultations. The documentation should be maintained and updated as necessary to reflect changes to the data processing activities or the DPIA process.

Implement mitigation strategies to address any identified risks or concerns. This includes implementing technical, organizational, and administrative controls to minimize the potential impact of data breaches or other security incidents. The mitigation strategies should be documented and communicated to all relevant stakeholders.

Regularly review and update the DPIA process to ensure it remains effective and relevant. This includes reviewing the scope and objectives, the assessment of data processing activities, and the results of stakeholder consultations. The review should be conducted at least annually or whenever there are significant changes to the data processing activities.

requirement_title: Measures to be undertaken by Significant Data Fiduciary
requirement: A Significant Data Fiduciary shall undertake other measures specified under sub-clause (iii) of clause (c) of sub-section (2) of section 10.
requirement_description: Organizations that are Significant Data Fiduciaries must undertake other measures specified under sub-clause (iii) of clause (c) of sub-section (2) of section 10.

controls.control: Conduct a thorough risk assessment to identify potential risks associated with the Significant Data Fiduciary's obligations under sub-clause (iii) of clause (c) of sub-section (2) of section 10. This risk assessment should be documented and reviewed regularly to ensure ongoing compliance.

Develop and implement a compliance framework that outlines the Significant Data Fiduciary's policies, procedures, and guidelines for meeting its obligations under sub-clause (iii) of clause (c) of sub-section (2) of section 10. This framework should be communicated to all relevant stakeholders and reviewed regularly to ensure ongoing compliance.

Provide regular training and awareness programs for employees and other relevant stakeholders on the Significant Data Fiduciary's obligations under sub-clause (iii) of clause (c) of sub-section (2) of section 10. This training should cover the key requirements and expectations of the Significant Data Fiduciary's compliance obligations.

Implement monitoring and reporting mechanisms to ensure ongoing compliance with the Significant Data Fiduciary's obligations under sub-clause (iii) of clause (c) of sub-section (2) of section 10. This should include regular reporting to senior management and the board of directors on compliance status and any areas for improvement.

Maintain accurate and complete records of all activities related to the Significant Data Fiduciary's obligations under sub-clause (iii) of clause (c) of sub-section (2) of section 10. This should include records of risk assessments, compliance training, and monitoring and reporting activities.

requirement_title: Manner of making a request to obtain information and other information related to personal data
requirement: A Data Principal shall make a request to obtain information and other information related to personal data in a manner specified under sub-section (1) of section 11.
requirement_description: Individuals must make a request to obtain information and other information related to personal data in a manner specified under sub-section (1) of section 11.

controls.control: Implement a standardized data access request form that captures the necessary information from the Data Principal, including their name, contact details, and the specific information they are requesting. The form should be easily accessible and available on the organization's website or intranet.

Establish a clear and transparent process for handling data access requests, including timelines for response and provision of information. The process should be communicated to all Data Principals and made available on the organization's website or intranet.

Implement a tracking system to monitor and record all data access requests, including the date and time of receipt, the status of the request, and the outcome. This will help to ensure that requests are handled in a timely and efficient manner.

Notify the Data Principal of the outcome of their data access request, including any information that has been provided or any reasons for refusal. This notification should be made in a timely and transparent manner.

Implement measures to authenticate the identity of the Data Principal making the request, such as verifying their contact details or requiring them to provide proof of identity. This will help to prevent unauthorized access to personal data.

Establish an escalation process for handling complex or sensitive data access requests, including the involvement of senior personnel or a data protection officer. This will help to ensure that requests are handled in a timely and effective manner.

requirement_title: Manner of making a request for erasure of personal data
requirement: A Data Principal shall make a request for erasure of personal data in a manner specified under sub-section (3) of section 12.
requirement_description: Individuals must make a request for erasure of personal data in a manner specified under sub-section (3) of section 12.

controls.control: Establish a clear process for handling data subject requests for erasure of personal data. This process should include procedures for verifying the identity of the data subject, assessing the request, and ensuring that all relevant personal data is erased in a timely manner.

Develop a standardized form for data subjects to submit their requests for erasure of personal data. The form should include fields for the data subject's contact information, a description of the personal data they wish to have erased, and any other relevant details.

Implement a system to track and manage data subject requests for erasure of personal data. This system should allow for the assignment of unique identifiers to each request, tracking of the request's status, and notification of the data subject when the request has been fulfilled.

Develop a procedure for acknowledging receipt of data subject requests for erasure of personal data. This acknowledgement should be sent to the data subject within a specified timeframe (e.g., 3-5 business days) and should include a reference to the unique identifier assigned to the request.

Establish a procedure for erasing personal data in response to a data subject request. This procedure should include steps for identifying and locating the relevant personal data, verifying its accuracy, and securely deleting or anonymizing the data.

Develop a procedure for notifying the data subject when their personal data has been erased. This notification should be sent to the data subject within a specified timeframe (e.g., 3-5 business days) and should include a confirmation that the data has been erased.

requirement_title: Period within which the Data Fiduciary shall respond to grievances
requirement: A Data Fiduciary shall respond to grievances within a period specified under sub-section (2) of section 13.
requirement_description: Organizations must respond to grievances within a period specified under sub-section (2) of section 13.

controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall establish a clear and specific timeframe for responding to grievances, as specified under sub-section (2) of section 13. This timeframe shall be communicated to all stakeholders, including customers and employees.

The Data Fiduciary shall designate a team responsible for responding to grievances. This team shall be trained to handle grievances in a timely and effective manner, and shall have the necessary resources and authority to resolve grievances.

The Data Fiduciary shall develop a clear and documented process for responding to grievances. This process shall include steps for receiving, investigating, and resolving grievances, as well as procedures for escalating complex or sensitive grievances.

controls.control_title: Monitor and Report on Grievance Response Times
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall regularly monitor and report on the time taken to respond to grievances. This shall help identify areas for improvement and ensure that the grievance response process is operating effectively.

controls.control_title: Communicate Grievance Response Information to Stakeholders
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall communicate clear and concise information about the grievance response process to all stakeholders, including customers and employees. This shall include information on the timeframe for responding to grievances, the contact details for the grievance response team, and the procedures for escalating complex or sensitive grievances.

requirement: The Data Principal shall nominate an individual under sub-section (1) of section 14.
requirement_description: The Data Principal must specify the manner of nominating an individual to act on their behalf.

controls.control: The Data Principal shall nominate a representative who will act on their behalf in all matters related to data processing and compliance with the regulations. This representative should be a senior-level employee or executive with the authority to make decisions and take actions on behalf of the Data Principal.

The Data Principal shall maintain a record of the nomination process, including the name and contact information of the nominated representative, the date of nomination, and any relevant documentation or evidence supporting the nomination. This documentation should be stored securely and made available for inspection upon request.

controls.control_title: Communication of Nomination to Relevant Parties
controls.control: The Data Principal shall notify all relevant parties, including employees, contractors, and third-party vendors, of the nominated representative's contact information and authority. This notification should be made in a timely manner and should include any necessary instructions or guidance on how to interact with the nominated representative.

The Data Principal shall regularly review and update the nomination of the representative to ensure that it remains valid and effective. This review should be conducted at least annually, or as necessary, and should include verification that the nominated representative still meets the necessary qualifications and has the necessary authority to act on behalf of the Data Principal.

requirement: The personal data shall be processed in accordance with the standards specified under clause (b) of sub-section (2) of section 17.
requirement_description: Personal data must be processed in accordance with the specified standards to be eligible for exemption.

controls.control: Establish a standardized data processing framework that outlines the procedures for collecting, storing, and managing personal data in accordance with clause (b) of sub-section (2) of section 17. This framework should be communicated to all personnel involved in data processing.

controls.control_title: Data Protection by Design and Default
controls.control: Implement data protection by design and default principles in all data processing systems and applications. This includes ensuring that personal data is pseudonymized, encrypted, and access-controlled by default.

Implement a role-based access control system that restricts access to personal data to authorized personnel only. This includes assigning unique usernames and passwords, and regularly reviewing and updating access permissions.

Establish a data retention and disposal policy that outlines the procedures for storing, archiving, and deleting personal data in accordance with clause (b) of sub-section (2) of section 17. This policy should be communicated to all personnel involved in data processing.

Provide regular data protection training to all personnel involved in data processing, including training on the standardized data processing framework, data protection by design and default principles, and data access and authorization procedures.

Establish a data breach incident response plan that outlines the procedures for responding to and managing data breaches in accordance with clause (b) of sub-section (2) of section 17. This plan should be communicated to all personnel involved in data processing.

requirement: The Chairperson and other Members of the Board shall be appointed under sub-section (2) of section 19.
requirement_description: The Chairperson and other Members of the Board must be appointed in accordance with the specified manner.

controls.control: Verify that the Chairperson has been appointed under sub-section (2) of section 19, as per the organization's bylaws or governing documents.

Establish a process to verify that all Members of the Board have been appointed under sub-section (2) of section 19, including documentation of the appointment process and approval by the relevant authorities.

Regularly review the composition of the Board to ensure that all Members, including the Chairperson, have been appointed in accordance with sub-section (2) of section 19, and make adjustments as necessary to maintain compliance.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of the appointment process for the Chairperson and other Members of the Board, including records of approval by the relevant authorities and any relevant supporting documentation.

requirement_title: Salary and Terms of Board Members
requirement: The Chairperson and other Members of the Board shall receive salary, allowances, and other terms and conditions of services under sub-section (1) of section 20.
requirement_description: The Chairperson and other Members of the Board must receive the specified salary, allowances, and other terms and conditions of services.

controls.control: Establish a clear and transparent structure for salaries and allowances for the Chairperson and other Members of the Board, including the basis for calculation, payment frequency, and any other relevant details. This structure should be documented and communicated to all stakeholders.

Verify that the salary, allowances, and other terms and conditions of services for the Chairperson and other Members of the Board comply with the requirements specified in sub-section (1) of section 20. This includes ensuring that all necessary approvals and documentation are in place.

controls.control_title: Review and Update Terms and Conditions Regularly
controls.control: Regularly review and update the terms and conditions of services for the Chairperson and other Members of the Board to ensure they remain compliant with relevant laws and regulations, and to reflect any changes in the organization's policies or procedures.

controls.control_title: Maintain Records of Salary and Allowance Payments
controls.control: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of salary and allowance payments made to the Chairperson and other Members of the Board, including payment dates, amounts, and any other relevant details.

Ensure that all salary, allowance, and other benefits paid to the Chairperson and other Members of the Board are transparent and subject to regular review and audit to prevent any potential conflicts of interest or abuse of authority.

requirement: Orders, directions, and instruments shall be authenticated under sub-section (1) of section 23.
requirement_description: Orders, directions, and instruments must be authenticated in accordance with the specified manner.

controls.control_title: Authentication of Orders, Directions, and Instruments
controls.control: Implement a digital signature or electronic authentication mechanism to verify the authenticity of orders, directions, and instruments. This mechanism should be integrated with the existing system to ensure seamless authentication and minimize manual errors.

Maintain a record of the authentication process, including the date, time, and details of the authenticated orders, directions, and instruments. This documentation should be easily accessible and retrievable for audit purposes.

Provide regular training to users on the authentication process, including the use of digital signatures or electronic authentication mechanisms. This training should cover best practices and procedures for authenticating orders, directions, and instruments.

controls.control_title: Regular Review and Update of Authentication Mechanism
controls.control: Regularly review and update the authentication mechanism to ensure it remains effective and compliant with regulatory requirements. This review should be conducted at least annually or as required by regulatory changes.
Implement audit trails to track all authentication activities, including successful and unsuccessful attempts. This audit trail should be easily accessible and retrievable for audit purposes.

requirement_title: Terms and Conditions of Board Officers and Employees
requirement: Officers and employees of the Board shall be appointed and served under the terms and conditions specified under section 24.
requirement_description: Officers and employees of the Board must be appointed and served in accordance with the specified terms and conditions.

controls.control_title: Verify Officer and Employee Appointment Terms
controls.control: Ensure that all officers and employees of the Board are appointed under the terms and conditions specified under section 24. This includes verifying the appointment process, ensuring that all necessary documentation is completed, and maintaining a record of appointments.

Develop and maintain clear criteria for appointing officers and employees of the Board, including qualifications, experience, and skills required for each role. This will help ensure that appointments are made in accordance with section 24.
Keep accurate and up-to-date records of all appointments made under section 24, including dates of appointment, terms of appointment, and any changes to appointment details.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Review of Appointment Processes
controls.control: Regularly review and assess the appointment processes for officers and employees of the Board to ensure they are operating effectively and in accordance with section 24. This may involve reviewing documentation, conducting interviews, and gathering feedback from stakeholders.

Provide training and guidance to officers and employees of the Board on the appointment procedures and requirements specified under section 24. This will help ensure that all staff understand their roles and responsibilities in the appointment process.

requirement: The Board shall adopt techno-legal measures under sub-section (1) of section 28.
requirement_description: The Board must adopt the specified techno-legal measures.

controls.control: Develop and implement a comprehensive cybersecurity framework that outlines the techno-legal measures to be adopted by the organization. This framework should include policies, procedures, and guidelines for managing cybersecurity risks.

Conduct regular risk assessments to identify potential cybersecurity threats and vulnerabilities. This should include identifying, assessing, and prioritizing risks, as well as implementing controls to mitigate or manage those risks.

Implement access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to sensitive information and systems. This should include implementing user authentication, authorization, and accounting (AAA) mechanisms, as well as regular reviews of access rights and privileges.

Develop an incident response plan that outlines the procedures to be followed in the event of a cybersecurity incident. This should include identifying incident response teams, defining roles and responsibilities, and establishing communication protocols.

Provide regular cybersecurity awareness training to employees to educate them on cybersecurity best practices and the importance of maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of sensitive information.
Implement encryption to protect sensitive information both in transit and at rest. This should include encrypting data stored on devices, in databases, and during transmission over networks.

requirement_title: Form and Fee for Filing Appeals
requirement: An appeal shall be filed in the specified form, manner, and fee under sub-section (2) of section 29.
requirement_description: An appeal must be filed in the specified form, manner, and fee.

controls.control: Ensure that the appeal form is completed accurately and in its entirety, adhering to the specified format and layout. Verify that all required fields are filled in and that the form is signed by the authorized person.

Establish a secure and reliable process for filing appeals, ensuring that they are submitted through the designated channel (e.g., online portal, mail, or in-person). Verify that the appeal is received by the designated deadline.

Implement a system to collect and verify the required fee for filing an appeal. Ensure that the fee is paid in the specified manner (e.g., online payment, check, or money order) and that the receipt is attached to the appeal.

Designate a reviewer to examine the appeal form for completeness and accuracy. Ensure that the reviewer verifies the form against the specified requirements and notifies the applicant of any discrepancies or omissions.

Maintain a secure and organized storage system for appeal forms, ensuring that they are easily accessible and retrievable when needed. Implement a retention policy for appeal forms, specifying the duration for which they will be retained.

requirement: An appeal shall be dealt with under the procedure specified under sub-section (8) of section 29.
requirement_description: An appeal must be dealt with in accordance with the specified procedure.

controls.control: Establish a clear and documented procedure for dealing with appeals under sub-section (8) of section 29. This procedure should be communicated to all relevant stakeholders, including employees and customers.

Designate a team or individual responsible for handling appeals under sub-section (8) of section 29. This team should have the necessary skills, knowledge, and resources to handle appeals efficiently and effectively.

Maintain a record of all appeal outcomes, including the decision made, the reasons for the decision, and any subsequent actions taken. This will help to ensure transparency and accountability in the appeal process.

Establish clear timeframes for dealing with appeals under sub-section (8) of section 29. This will help to ensure that appeals are processed in a timely and efficient manner, and that stakeholders are aware of when to expect a decision.

Ensure that all relevant stakeholders, including employees and customers, are aware of the appeal procedure and the timeframes for dealing with appeals. This can be achieved through training, communication, and documentation.

Regularly review and update the appeal procedure to ensure that it remains effective and efficient. This may involve seeking feedback from stakeholders, identifying areas for improvement, and making changes as necessary.

requirement: Rules and notifications shall be laid before each House of Parliament for a total period of thirty days.
requirement_description: Rules and notifications must be laid before each House of Parliament for a specified period.

controls.control: Develop and maintain a schedule for laying rules and notifications before each House of Parliament. This schedule should be shared with all relevant stakeholders and updated regularly to ensure compliance with the 30-day requirement.

Appoint a compliance officer responsible for ensuring that rules and notifications are laid before each House of Parliament within the 30-day timeframe. This officer should be accountable for monitoring progress and reporting any deviations from the schedule.

Develop and implement a tracking system to monitor the progress of rules and notifications as they move through the approval process. This system should provide real-time updates on the status of each item and alert the compliance officer to any potential delays.

Perform regular audits to ensure that the rules and notifications are being laid before each House of Parliament within the 30-day timeframe. These audits should be conducted at least quarterly and should review the effectiveness of the tracking system and compliance officer.

Develop a communication plan to inform all relevant stakeholders, including Parliament members and the public, about the rules and notifications that will be laid before each House of Parliament. This plan should include regular updates on the status of each item and any changes to the schedule.

Perform regression testing to ensure that rule modifications do not break existing functionality or introduce new bugs. This testing should be performed after each rule modification and should include testing of all affected systems and processes.

controls.control: Establish a task force within the Central Government to identify and address difficulties arising from the Act. The task force should comprise representatives from relevant departments and stakeholders to ensure a comprehensive approach.

controls.control_title: Define a Clear Removal of Difficulties Process
controls.control: Develop a clear and transparent process for removing difficulties arising from the Act. This process should include timelines, responsibilities, and communication channels to ensure that stakeholders are informed and engaged throughout the process.

controls.control_title: Provide Training and Support to Stakeholders
controls.control: Provide training and support to stakeholders, including government officials, businesses, and individuals, to help them understand and comply with the Act. This training should be ongoing and tailored to the specific needs of each stakeholder group.

controls.control_title: Monitor and Review Removal of Difficulties Progress
controls.control: Regularly monitor and review the progress of removing difficulties arising from the Act. This should include tracking the number of difficulties addressed, the time taken to resolve each difficulty, and the effectiveness of the removal of difficulties process.

controls.control_title: Establish a Central Government Website for Removal of Difficulties Information
controls.control: Establish a dedicated website within the Central Government to provide information on the removal of difficulties process, including guidance, FAQs, and contact details for stakeholders to seek assistance.

controls.control_title: Develop a Removal of Difficulties Communication Plan
controls.control: Develop a communication plan to inform stakeholders about the removal of difficulties process, including regular updates, newsletters, and social media posts. This plan should be tailored to the specific needs of each stakeholder group.

requirement_description: This requirement ensures that the Central Government does not make orders to remove difficulties beyond a certain timeframe.

controls.control: The Central Government shall maintain a compliance calendar to track the commencement date of the Act and ensure that no orders to remove difficulties are made after three years from the Act's commencement. The calendar shall be reviewed and updated regularly to ensure compliance with the Act.

The Central Government shall maintain a system of record-keeping to track all orders to remove difficulties made under the Act. This system shall include the date of each order, the reason for the order, and the status of the order. The system shall be accessible to authorized personnel and shall be used to monitor compliance with the Act.

The Central Government shall conduct regular compliance audits to ensure that no orders to remove difficulties are made after three years from the Act's commencement. The audits shall be conducted at least annually and shall include a review of the compliance calendar and the system of record-keeping.

The Central Government shall provide training to personnel on the requirements of the Act and the procedures for making orders to remove difficulties. The training shall include information on the three-year limit and the importance of maintaining accurate records.

The Central Government shall establish a compliance officer who shall be responsible for ensuring compliance with the Act. The compliance officer shall be authorized to review and approve all orders to remove difficulties and shall be responsible for monitoring compliance with the Act.

controls.control_title: Establish a Central Government Committee for Difficulty Removal
controls.control: Establish a committee comprising senior officials from relevant departments to review and recommend orders for removing difficulties. The committee should be responsible for ensuring that the orders are in line with the Central Government's policies and objectives.

controls.control_title: Define Clear Criteria for Difficulty Removal Orders
controls.control: Develop and publish clear criteria for determining which difficulties require orders for removal. The criteria should be based on the impact of the difficulty on the public, businesses, or individuals, and should be regularly reviewed and updated as needed.

controls.control_title: Develop a Standardized Process for Difficulty Removal Orders
controls.control: Establish a standardized process for preparing, reviewing, and approving difficulty removal orders. The process should include clear roles and responsibilities, timelines, and checklists to ensure that orders are prepared and approved efficiently and effectively.

controls.control_title: Provide Training and Awareness for Officials
controls.control: Provide regular training and awareness programs for officials involved in preparing and approving difficulty removal orders. The training should cover the Central Government's policies and objectives, the criteria for difficulty removal orders, and the standardized process for preparing and approving orders.

controls.control_title: Maintain a Record of Difficulty Removal Orders
controls.control: Maintain a record of all difficulty removal orders, including the date of issuance, the criteria used to determine the difficulty, and the impact of the order on the public, businesses, or individuals. The record should be regularly reviewed and updated to ensure that it is accurate and complete.

Publish difficulty removal orders on the Central Government's website and other public platforms to ensure transparency and accountability. The orders should be easily accessible and searchable by date, topic, or keyword.

Engage with key stakeholders, including industry associations, consumer groups, and regulatory bodies, to gather feedback and input on the proposed amendments to the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India Act.

Conduct a thorough review of the existing Telecom Regulatory Authority of India Act and related regulations to identify areas that require amendment. This review should consider changes in technology, market trends, and regulatory best practices.

controls.control_title: Finalize Amendments and Submit to Parliament
controls.control: Based on the feedback received during the public comment period, finalize the amendments to the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India Act. The finalized amendments should be submitted to Parliament for approval and enactment.

controls.control_title: Conduct a Risk Assessment for Online Activities
controls.control: Conduct a thorough risk assessment to identify potential risks associated with online activities, including but not limited to, data breaches, cyber attacks, and unauthorized access to computer systems or networks. controls.control_title: Implement Access Controls for Online Systems
controls.control: Implement access controls for online systems, including but not limited to, authentication, authorization, and accounting (AAA) mechanisms, to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to sensitive data and systems. This includes implementing strong passwords, multi-factor authentication, and role-based access controls.

controls.control_title: Establish Incident Response Plan for Cyber Attacks
controls.control: Establish an incident response plan to respond to cyber attacks, including but not limited to, data breaches, malware attacks, and denial-of-service (DoS) attacks. This plan should include procedures for containment, eradication, recovery, and post-incident activities.

Conduct regular security audits to ensure that online systems and networks are secure and compliant with relevant laws and regulations. This includes conducting vulnerability assessments, penetration testing, and compliance audits.

controls.control_title: Implement Data Encryption for Sensitive Data
controls.control: Implement data encryption for sensitive data, including but not limited to, personal identifiable information (PII), financial information, and confidential business information. This includes implementing encryption protocols, such as SSL/TLS, and encrypting data in transit and at rest.

controls.control: Establish a clear policy that defines what constitutes personal information and ensure that all employees understand the importance of handling such information with care. This policy should be communicated to all stakeholders and updated regularly to reflect any changes in laws or regulations.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Training and Awareness Programs
controls.control: Organize regular training and awareness programs for employees on the handling of personal information, including the importance of confidentiality, data protection, and the consequences of non-compliance. This will ensure that employees are equipped to handle personal information responsibly.

Implement robust access controls and authentication mechanisms to ensure that only authorized personnel can access personal information. This includes using secure login credentials, two-factor authentication, and role-based access controls.

controls.control_title: Use Secure Data Storage and Transmission
controls.control: Use secure data storage and transmission mechanisms to protect personal information from unauthorized access or interception. This includes using encryption, secure databases, and secure communication protocols.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of personal information handling procedures, including the collection, storage, and disclosure of personal information. This will help to ensure transparency and accountability in the handling of personal information.

Establish a clear complaint handling process for individuals who believe that their personal information has been mishandled or disclosed inappropriately. This will provide a mechanism for individuals to raise concerns and seek redress.
